review.itemreviewed: Eigerjoch Advanced IN Hooded Down Jacket - Women's
review.reviewBody: Wife loves and wears often. Compresses small and provides good warmth.

review.itemreviewed: Eigerjoch Advanced IN Hooded Down Jacket - Women's
review.reviewBody: Fits great. I can wear it over a light layer if needed. Love the cut and color scheme. I ordered an extra small. I am usually a small so sizing down might be a good idea if you are on the cusp.

review.itemreviewed: Eigerjoch Advanced IN Hooded Down Jacket - Women's
review.reviewBody: This jacket is perfect for whatever you are planning on doing. Because it is poly-fill, it stays warm even when wet. Great layer for spring ice climbing. Flattering fit also!
review.name: I absolutely love this jacket!

review.itemreviewed: Eigerjoch Advanced IN Hooded Down Jacket - Women's
review.reviewBody: I wear this under my shell skiing and ice climbing and it has kept me super warm on even below-zero days in the northeast. Not to mention the color is fantastic! I get so many compliments on how vibrant it looks with the snow. Great quality and very warm! This item is great for anyone looking for a thicker puffy jacket under their shell, for both beginners and experts in the outdoors.
review.name: Best Mid Layer!!

review.itemreviewed: Eigerjoch Advanced IN Hooded Down Jacket - Women's
review.reviewBody: Wore this jacket on a ski and sailing trip to Norway. It was the perfect extra layer underneath a shell to keep in my pack. Folds up extra small. Perfect to keep as an extra layer during a tour and kept me insanely warm while sailing in sun zero temps. Great for all levels of skiiers.

review.itemreviewed: Eigerjoch Advanced IN Hooded Down Jacket - Women's
review.reviewBody: Extremely warm, very lightweight. I sized up so I could layer underneath but I don't think it was necessary, I'd say the jacket runs a little large.

review.itemreviewed: Eigerjoch Advanced IN Hooded Down Jacket - Women's
review.reviewBody: I went ice climbing on a very cold day and this jacket along with base layers kept me warm and dry!
review.name: Minnesota Arctic Ice Climbing üëç

review.itemreviewed: Eigerjoch Advanced IN Hooded Down Jacket - Women's
review.reviewBody: Super light but warm, I really like the long length. A great backcountry ski jacket
review.name: Great ski coat

review.itemreviewed: Eigerjoch Advanced IN Hooded Down Jacket - Women's
review.reviewBody: I was looking for a warm jacket that wasn't too bulky or big. We have long, snowy, cold winters, and this jacket is perfect for around town during fall and throughout winter and it's also a great layer for backcountry and resort skiing.
review.name: Warm, stylish, multi-purpose

review.itemreviewed: Eigerjoch Advanced IN Hooded Down Jacket - Women's
review.reviewBody: I get compliments on this jacket all of the time. It is light weight and very warm.
review.name: Love this Jacket!

name: Eigerjoch Advanced IN Hooded Down Jacket - Women's

review.reviewBody: I love this jacket. You cannot beat it for the price.  It is super warm and cozy. It looks good. The sleeves are long. The zipper pocket in the chest is small but useful.
review.name: I think everyone loves teddy bears 🤔

review.reviewBody: this jacket is good for when a sweatshirt layer just isn't cutting it.  as other review says; do i look slightly like a big teddy bear? maybe, but that doesn't bother me.  i love the hood, has nice big pockets. pretty warm and fits well for the price
review.name: great jacket for fall temps

review.reviewBody:
This coat def scored styles points if you’re looking for pimping teddy bear vibes. 

Sadly, I don’t have great feedback to provide around the construction quality of my new stuffed animal swagger jacket and likely will avoid Stoic after this. 

Notes about product:
*the inner liner lacks a reasonable amount of stitching to keep it in place/keep it safe from ripping. 
*stitching around cuffs and other places looks like I did it and my sewing skills are minimal. 
*zippers are YKK, so shoutout on that, but there’s some extra protection around hood that gets caught up. 
*has a pretty nice inner pocket.
review.name: Cool vibe; poor construction

name: Crossover Hooded Jacket - Men's

review.itemreviewed: Vista Dual Boa Snowboard Boot - 2025 - Women's
review.reviewBody: These boots are awful around your foot. I have a wider foot for women and sized down half a size. My toes can just barely hit the front of the boot which is ideal, and my entire heal is still lifting up. I like the stiffness but it does nothing when you’re heal is lifting. I’m a snowboard guide and if you’re anywhere from beginner to advanced these boots are terrible for anyone.
review.name: Horrible heal lift
comment: Hey, thank you for taking the time to share your feedback with us. We often adjust our products based on direct customer feedback. We will make sure to pass this along to our designers for consideration in future products.

review.itemreviewed: Vista Dual Boa Snowboard Boot - 2025 - Women's
review.reviewBody: I have been riding these 6-7 days a week since the start of last season.  I work as an instructor and use them every day for work and also for free riding! I love these boots! They fit me perfectly out of the box, no break in pain and have held out into this season with no issues or breakdown.  They are still stiff and responsive even after over 100 days on snow.  I was hoping for a new design this year but will definitely be buying these again when these eventually wear out! Thanks Salomon!
review.name: Amazing boots

review.itemreviewed: Vista Dual Boa Snowboard Boot - 2025 - Women's
review.reviewBody: After our initial excitement that Salomon finally brought back an advanced boot for female freeriders, my team was disappointed to find that this boot doesn't fit women but is essentially the men's Malamute but in different colors. The heel cup is huge, our heels just slide around in them even with the boas at max tightness, so we got exactly the opposite of the control in all-mountain conditions that this boot is supposed to provide. We can't wait until Salomon brings back a stiff women's boot for advanced riding like their old Moxie, hope it happens soon!
review.name: Love the stiffness. Hate the fit.
comment: Hello, I appreciate you sharing your feedback with us. We constantly work to get better! Please keep in mind that your suggestions are being taken into consideration!

review.itemreviewed: Vista Dual Boa Snowboard Boot - 2025 - Women's
review.reviewBody: This boot is on the stiffer side. It's exactly what I've been looking for in a Salomon boot. The construction looks and feels bulletproof. The liner is solidly made, comfortable, and heat moldable. Five days on snow and I've had no issues.
review.name: Well Made Boot

name: Vista Dual Boa Snowboard Boot - 2025 - Women's

review.reviewBody: The first pair of Anacapas were great. Good support and durability. Lasted me 6 months. This latest pair have proven not as good. This pair has a tendency to collapse my medial arch. I'll need arch supports to help me traverse the mountains and rugged hills. Really hard on my ankles.
review.name: These Anacapas have a tendency towards medial collapse.

review.reviewBody: It's a weird fit , I feel very tight, but at the same time it's my size . I have other more comfortable hoka . Love the color and the design
review.name: Love the color , still it's a weird fit

review.reviewBody: Transport is a perfect all around for on and off road. Followed this with a more aggressive Anacapa. Looks large on your feet but well worth the results you get while hiking and such. I'm more comfortable wearing transports but the tongue webbing on the sides in the Anacapa are more defensive of debris entering the shoe. Anacapa is more agressive but both are amazing. Transport GTX is awesome, though.
review.name: Love the fit and Cush of the Transport

review.reviewBody: I bought these shoes to play golf in. They work fine for golf, but like others have mentioned the fit is too tight in the toe. Especially in the right foot. Has given me a blister on my right big toe. Loosened the laces at the toe, maybe better. Planning to try a thinner sock. Still have 30 days to exchange....we'll see how it goes
review.name: Not a perfect fit

review.reviewBody: Bought these because I love my wide bondis. I love the shoes but can't wear them. They are to narrow for me and squeeze my outside two toes together so they hurt. Back to my keen hikers I guess.
review.name: Not as wide as wide 2E Hoka bondi

review.reviewBody: These are the freaking best shoe, I have had in a long time! They are slip ons and you can hike in them. Very comfortable and fit almost perfectly!
review.name: Amazing

review.reviewBody: they're very comfortable I wore them to dinner last night nice and stylish.
review.name: I want work boot that are as comfortable as my new Hoka's.

review.reviewBody: I just came back from 2 weeks hiking in Colorado and Utah. I bought the Anacapa 2 as I was looking for something lightweight and "small" given I was travelling on a motorcycle and did not want to use up the entire space of one of my panniers for full-size hiking boots. I was in between trail running shoes and a low hiking shoe. After having examined the difference between both, I went with a hiking shoe due to the more stable/ durable sole accepting the weight disadvantage. I am super happy with the Anacapa 2. It performed very well on uneven rocky terrain in the Colorado Rocky's (and Great Basin) and did equally well in Utah on sand and smooth rock. Good grip and decent dampening. Of course I did not expect the same ancle support as I would get from a full-height 6-8in boot. On top of all that, I like the styling of the shoe not being overly flashy allowing it to be the only pair of non-motorcycle shoes I took on this trip. If I would need to find one Con, it would be more of a personal problem than a Hoka problem. I have narrow feet and believe that a C width would be even better than the D width offered.
review.name: Lightweight hiking in style

review.reviewBody: Needed a new shoe for lite hiking with the dogs that had good tread and was comfortable too. This HOKA shoe fits that need perfectly. Would purchase again if this pair ever wore out, which is doubtful.
review.name: A most comfortable hiking shoe!

review.reviewBody: Trades my 11 for an 11.5 but still not comfortable
review.name: Still not afit

name: Anacapa 2 Freedom Hiking Shoe - Men's

review.itemreviewed: Mont Blanc BOA Trail Running Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: I work long hours in a restaurant with pressed cement floors. These shoes are fantastic! I do wish they came in some basic colors. I was hesitant about the boa system on a shoe, but I love the adjustability.
review.name: My Favorites!

review.itemreviewed: Mont Blanc BOA Trail Running Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: Running and hiking. Just love these shoes. Love the fit and the lacing.
review.name: Like a fast moving cloud

review.itemreviewed: Mont Blanc BOA Trail Running Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: These are some of the best trail hiking shoes I have ever had. I love the no lace design, nothing gets caught. I can go from urban to mountain sides and not think twice.
review.name: 1 Year Strong

review.itemreviewed: Mont Blanc BOA Trail Running Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: I did have to buy them 1/2 size up to get closer to the width of my other Altras, but that's ok. I love the new little twisty buckles!
review.name: I love these Altras!!

review.itemreviewed: Mont Blanc BOA Trail Running Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: Recovering from a foot fracture where ortho requires a loose fit across the top of the shoe or altered lacing but rigid. Great support overall. My foot in narrow so I wouldn't go full size up.
review.name: Recovery with stability

review.itemreviewed: Mont Blanc BOA Trail Running Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: Did a 3 mile loop with every kind of terrain: gravel, water crossing, granite slabs. I learned to trust the grip on wet rocks, and even mossy covered steep faces. Every part of my body was sore the next day, except for my feet. I wish they made a GoreTex option. My only issue is the upper is a little on the light side and I avoid wearing them in wet conditions. I also have to say.. I get a lot of head turns with the boa system and styling, they get a lot of looks in the creative studio spaces I work in. I wish they offered more experimental colorways.
review.name: Incredibly grippy

review.itemreviewed: Mont Blanc BOA Trail Running Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: Sooooo comfortable and mildly rigid. I would definitely order a full size up. I tried 1/2 sizing up and I wouldn't be comfortable wearing socks. But overall, I love the look and overall comfort of the shoe:-)
review.name: Not your grandma's orthopedic shoe

review.itemreviewed: Mont Blanc BOA Trail Running Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: This shoe is so great and comfortable for everyday wear and walks. However, I personally would not recommend for running. The lower boa rubs my foot and leaves it sore after long runs.
review.name: Comfortable shoe

review.itemreviewed: Mont Blanc BOA Trail Running Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: The best. Love the turn knob lace ups. Love the shape and how sturdy and strong I feel in them. They make me brave. Please make more colors! I want some black ones and some red ones and some pink and purple ones.
review.name: I love these shoes so much. I own like 6 pairs.

review.itemreviewed: Mont Blanc BOA Trail Running Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: From the moment I put these on, I knew I was going to buy a second pair. From the BOA you get a great and effortless fit.
review.name: Solid and comfortable fit

name: Mont Blanc BOA Trail Running Shoe - Women's

review.reviewBody:

Purchased this when I bought a new Highline Dropper post because the dropper post description said the remote was not included.  Received the dropper post, and it included a remote, this was a redundant purchase.  Now I have to pay $7 to return an item that I would not have purchased had the dropper post description been correct.
review.name: Check first, before purchase

review.reviewBody: They run small, if you going to buy it I recommend you one size up
review.name: Super cute and conformable

review.reviewBody: These are my second pair of North Face sneakers after switching from Hokas/Brooks. As someone with flat feet/pronation, these shoes are built with good ankle support without needing inserts. I love these shoes and will continue buying!
review.name: Love the ankle support

review.reviewBody: I use these shoes as walking shoes and they are so comfortable. They have great arch and foot support. I have worn these shoes all day long and my feet were not sore or tired. I love the color of these shoes.
review.name: I would buy this product again and again

review.reviewBody: I bought these because I really like the color and look of them. I was surprised that they are really comfortable and high quality.
review.name: Love these

review.reviewBody: I sized up and glad I did. They are my walking shoe and were great the first time I wore them. They are a replacement of sneakers I purchased a few years ago from North Face. Very comfortable, well made and pleased with the purchase.
review.name: I would buy this product again.

review.reviewBody: Cute shoes and good for rough terrain. I took these to Arizona. I stepped in cholla cactus and these were tough enough to withstand the punctures and for the needles to be removed. These are also great for going in a light jog.
review.name: Good multi purpose shoes.

review.reviewBody: 1. TNF brand says it gives some thought to environmental costs of production!!! 2. Very Cushy!!! 3. Great Color!!!
review.name: Nice!

review.reviewBody: It's real comfortable shoe. It's light weight and good material.
review.name: Love it

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Mine are pink. I really like them. I had to go half size up. They are great for walking and standing. Good for running.
review.name: Good shoes

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Great fit for my daughter who has messed up feet from years of ballet. Will be further testing them out this Summer in Yosemite NP.
review.name: Great fit

review.itemreviewed: Race Face Oval Cinch Boost Direct Mount Traction Chainring
review.reviewBody: Bought for my 2017 5010. Super easy to install. Wanted a smaller front chainring for some of the climbs considering I?m in my 50s now. Definitely noticed a difference on the first few rides but pedaling seems exactly the same to me. Definitely recommend it.
review.name: Works well - no complaints

review.itemreviewed: Race Face Oval Cinch Boost Direct Mount Traction Chainring
review.reviewBody: This chain ring is a 6mm offset and my boost frame required a 3mm offset.  Had to return.  Have received the 3mm offset and love the Absolute Black Oval.
review.name: offset

review.itemreviewed: Race Face Oval Cinch Boost Direct Mount Traction Chainring
review.reviewBody:
Worthwhile upgrade. Nothing odd about the new pedal stroke; the only change is that torque to the wheels during climbing feels more even and natural.

On my first ride with the oval, I climbed for 2.5 miles on a rough, rutted trail at 13% average grade. I would have normally stood for several sections but was able to stay seated essentially the entire time.

Thumbs up. Just make sure you know whether you need a 3mm (boost) or 6mm offset. I forgot to check and ordered the wrong one at first.
review.name: Smoother torque during climbing

name: Race Face Oval Cinch Boost Direct Mount Traction Chainring

review.reviewBody:
Warm.. especially with layers.
Wouldn't run through a briar patch with this jacket but that's not why I bought it...good looking jacket.
review.name: Nice jacket

review.reviewBody: Over price and very light weight for a ski jacket. I got ripped off.
review.name: Don’t buy

review.reviewBody: The jacket is very light weight yet offers amazing warmth in the low teens.  The style and fit is perfect.  I'm 5'6, 155 lbs and size small fits perfectly.  Very highly recommended!!!
review.name: Awesome Jacket

review.reviewBody:
I needed something for cold mornings and winter hikes, also for night time dog walks... This fit my needs! I love this jacket. It fits great, its functional, there is plenty of storage, with 5 exterior pockets and one internal large pocket for a hat or gloves. 

Additionally, the fit and feel of the material and functionality is amazing. the armpits have nylon stretch material which is great for movement and comfort. 

Kuhl's makes great stuff, I wear there pants all the time and they hold up to my busy and rough life, very accident prone dad of three. This jacket is holding up great, after one season it still looks new after a wash following the instructions to the letter. 

I highly recommend it, price wise it is expensive, but considering its goose down and its not cut like a bag and has high functionality its worth it. I also plan to wear it for many seasons because I expect it to last.
review.name: Kool Jacket

name: Spyfire Hooded Down Jacket - Men's

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I am very happy with the product. It's a good size and solid. The only negative point is its weight (heavy).
review.name: Detour Stainless Steel Collapsible pot

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Love the Stainless Steel pots. Work great on induction & gas burners
review.name: Great Pots

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] These are first class for car/trailer camping. Fold up very small and stack inside each other but are still great pots with the heavy bases.. Also double as bowls for chips or? Friends have also purchased sets from my recommendation.
review.name: Detour Pots

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Great pot! haven't used it for cooking yet (but the similar kettle works great to heat water, so I assume this will heat up well too). minimal space needed for a good sized bowl for salads/stews, etc., and a great way to contain other collapsible sea to summit gear within this pot!
review.name: Great pot, nice size!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This stainless steel pot is perfect for outdoor camping and feasting. It's durable and easy to use! If you love camping, this is a must have in your camping gear
review.name: Great product!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Love this!! It works so well for camping and it’s super durable. The heat distribution is even and the silicone makes it super easy for cleaning. I definitely recommended this!!
review.name: Perfect for camping

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This pot is very nice and durable. It’s easy to store and transport. I like how it cooks noodles. It’s great for cooking and boiling. Easy to clean too.
review.name: Easy to clean

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Great stainless steel collapsible pot for camping or using in the kitchen it holds up great when cooking on a gas stove and I hand washed it this will definitely come in handy anytime your camping!
review.name: Great for camping!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] It’s not what I expected. Really small in size but has a good durability, great heat distribution and resistance. Easy to clean and light weight
review.name: Not the best purchase

review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Let me start off by saying that I ultimately do quite like this product, and I can recommend it if you're in need of a good portable cooking pot. However I do feel that it could definitely be better, and it falls short in a few ways (especially considering the price).

Out of the box, this feels and looks high-quality. Most of the body is stainless steel with only the middle section being silicon - this gives it a more premium feel than I was expecting. It's easy to collapse and expand the pot, I really love the portability aspect which works as well as I hoped. And I have no issues cooking in it, it heats up fairly quickly and works perfectly on both gas and induction. There's a lot of usability here, and not just for outdoor activities. If you have a small kitchen like I do, this thing really comes in handy. 

Now here come the cons. First of all, the locking handles (which lock the lid in place) are just terrible. They are extremely finicky, making them difficult to lock and unlock, they don't want to wiggle out of place and they tend to get stuck. They're small and poorly-made, and I don't like how they completely detach from the pot, I wish there was a place to keep them when not in use. Also, the design of the lid is also odd, it's only *very slightly* wider than the mouth of the pot, so it's difficult to get a tight seal since you have to line it up perfectly. If it were just a half-inch wider this wouldn't be an issue. 

But here's my main gripe: the stainless steel is not very stainless! Anybody who's familiar with SS knows that the material can stain (with hard water/mineral buildup/etc, I'm not sure what the exact term is but you know what I mean, those white/clear spots that develop on SS cutlery) especially if you don't dry it quickly after washing it. But this pot just takes that to a whole other level. After my first time using it, literally the entire bottom of the inside is covered in water spots. And it's difficult to remove, even with my tried-and-true cleaning methods! Again I'm very familiar with SS, I cook in it all the time, but this is just too much. I have never owned a SS pot that has discolored this quickly. I don't know what the issue is, are they using a cheap material or what? But it's very frustrating and makes me less likely to use this pot over others. 

All-in-all, I love the idea here and this thing really comes in handy. Perfect for camping, small spaces etc. But I hope the company goes back to the drawing board and tweaks some of the issues on display here (lousy lid and handles/stainless steel that's very prone to discoloration). I can still recommend it, as I said, but these issues bring down an otherwise great product, and I expect more considering the premium price tag.
review.name: Great concept, mixed execution

name: Detour Stainless Steel Collapsible 5L Pot

review.reviewBody: I do trail running in Colorado mostly and have been looking for a light, packable, breathable jacket with a hoodie. It literally started pouring on my first outing. Quick to unfold, straight out of a trail backpack, the important part for me, besides being waterproof was all the air vents that prevent sweating underneath. As soon as it stopped I folded it back into its small pocket and voila!!!! Love backcountry and thanks to their product review!
review.name: I finally found the one!!

review.reviewBody: Overall good lightweight design. Nice for layering or by itself around town or on the trail.
review.name: GOOD ALL AROUND JACKET

review.reviewBody:
I have to wonder if there's something wrong with my jacket. I bought this from the Chicago store based on positive reviews yet this jacket cannot be called "waterproof" in any meaningful way.

GOOD: Very lightweight and packable; lots of pockets; hood is well-designed. 

BAD: Not waterproof and barely water resistant. First time I used it was with an umbrella and it felt clammy. Water wasn't really beading off the surface. The real test was wearing it in a light rain without an umbrella. After 20 minutes, water was seeping through the back and sleeves.
review.name: Not waterproof

review.reviewBody: Just got the jacket. Very lightweight and packable; packs down very small, especially for the price. I can easily fit this into a sling bag over my chest for travel. Love that it has ventilation openings, as most jackets in this weight class lack any sort of pit zips or ventilation, and I tend to sweat inside rain jackets.  Fit is sim but good. Sleeves are a touch shorter than I prefer, but I'm long and lanky. At 6'3 170lbs the large fits me pretty well. Haven't had a chance to try it out in the rain, but I feel confident it will keep the sudden showers at bay, and I may reinforce the shoulders with some spray dwr. My only gripe is I was really excited for the "kalamata" color which on screen appears to be a tan/brown with maybe a touch of green. It is not. It is straight up forest green. No brown tone whatsoever. Still excited for the jacket though.
review.name: Lightweight, packable; color is off

review.reviewBody: This is a GREAT rain jacket. It’s more waterproof than most, and the yoke design adds breathability. But for those of us who walk in the city, or anywhere being visible is smart, dark colors are a poor option. FWIW, I’m probably not the only Backcountry customer waiting to buy a brighter Runoff; last year’s light silver colorway sold out.
review.name: One light color every year, please

review.reviewBody:
5/5 would recommend, lightweight and packable. Protects from rainstorms and keeps you dry

Get this and the MTN air hooded jacket and you are set for all your outdoor adventures.
review.name: Best rain jacket out there

review.reviewBody: Just got back from a 2 week trip to Italy where the forecast called for rain everyday. Packability and breathability were high on the priority list as space was limited and we were going to be on the move a lot. The jackets were perfect and took up minimal room in both our luggage and daypacks that we carried around town. The breathability was outstanding! With all the steps we put in, and there were a lot, never felt muggy or uncomfortable in anyway. Definitely recommend and will no doubt get lots of future use out of these!
review.name: Lives up to the name!

review.reviewBody: I really like this jacket. I am 5'10 160lbs and ordered a medium originally because the model in the pictures is 6'3 and wearing a medium, so I thought I would have plenty of extra room. As mentioned in other reviews, the fit is a bit off. The torso fit me great, but the shoulders/ armpits were pretty constricting unless my arms were straight down by my side. When moving my arms, the jacket would pull back on my arms and it just felt really uncomfortable, even though it looked amazing. I ended up returning and getting a large. The large solved the constricting problems I was experiencing, which came at a trade off because now the torso is slightly larger than I would have liked. It might sound like I'm speaking negatively, but seriously this jacket is awesome. I have worn it on long windy and rainy runs with absolutely 0 complaints. The material feels lightweight yet durable, and the vent in the back helps keep everything cool. My only recommendation to the Backcountry team is to make the plastic drawstring closure thing smaller. It seems way bigger than it should be it is almost comical. Overall, I'm giving this jacket 5 stars for functionality, style, and comfort. If you are in between sizes, definitely size up. I would highly recommend this jacket above anything Patagonia or The North Face.
review.name: My favorite rain jacket

review.reviewBody:
I picked up this jacket as an 'on the go' rain jacket that I can keep in my go bag, or in my office backpack so I can always have it on me on the bike commute. This jacket packs easily and conveniently into the chest pocket becoming the smallest thing I carry during my everyday activities. 

The fit works well for me despite having a bit of a strange torso, but has kept me dry during the first rainy days of spring here in Utah. 

The colors are fun and all the small trims are super cool!
review.name: Everything I wanted

review.reviewBody:
Incredibly lightweight rain shell, packs small, had no issues with leaks or water penetration after a 3 hour hike in a downpour with one exception (see below). Breathability is good but not amazing.

Main issue with this jacket is the fit. I wear a 16.5 / 35 dress shirt, and ordered a Large. This jacket has an athletic fit through the body (no issues) but the shoulders are snug and the sleeves too short. If I extend my arms out in front of me, even without a pack on, the sleeves pull 4 inches or so back from my wrist.
review.name: Great jacket, strange fit

name: Runoff 2.5L Rain Jacket - Men's
Runoff 2.5L Rain Jacket - Men's

review.itemreviewed: Divide 5 GTX Trail Running Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: The shoe is a little stiff, especially the upper, but that's probably due to waterproofing. It's not very cushy. It's decently wide in that I take the same size as all my other Brooks.
review.name: Does the job

review.itemreviewed: Divide 5 GTX Trail Running Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: Love these Divide 5 GTX for walking/running during wet months as they are completely waterproof, though they fit similar to my favorite Brooks running/walking shoe the Adreneline GTS 22, they do not have as much cushion which is why I gave 4 stars.
review.name: Feet stay dry…

review.itemreviewed: Divide 5 GTX Trail Running Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: Love these shoes! Can run through puddles and have no wet socks! The grip on the bottom is also helpful. Unfortunately, just lacking a bit of support for those fellow flat feet people, but easily fixed with a thin inner sole.
review.name: Love!

review.itemreviewed: Divide 5 GTX Trail Running Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: I got these for travelling in Europe. I do a lot of walking. I did not have time to break them in before travelling, and I didn't need to. I have worn these shoes full time for 2 weeks with no break-in issues. They are waterproof which is great for living in the Pacific Northwest. Brooks shoes have always worked right away for for me because the toe box is roomier than most brands but not sloppy or loose in the heels. I will always try Brooks first when buying new athletic style shoes.
review.name: Fit right out of the box

review.itemreviewed: Divide 5 GTX Trail Running Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: Lightweight, comfortable. Have rheumatoid arthritis and was recommended these by my rheumatologist. Local jogging to hiking in Northumberland, to gym.. I’ve barely had these off since I bought them.
review.name: Best trainers I’ve ever bought

review.itemreviewed: Divide 5 GTX Trail Running Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: Great comfort and great stability. Brilliant for trail running in the wet conditions.
review.name: Great trail shoe! .

review.itemreviewed: Divide 5 GTX Trail Running Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: Way too narrow. Not comfortable at all. I wish they came in wide size and I would love these shoes. They are very nice, gorgeous pair of brooks but unwearable due to how narrow the width is.

review.itemreviewed: Divide 5 GTX Trail Running Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: Well constructed and  neat, but for me the toe box was too small and my little toes were under pressure, so I sent them back. Odd as I've had standard Divides in the past in the same size and width and they fit perfectly, so wondering if it's the added waterproofing that's making them a tighter fit?
review.name: Good shoe but toe box too small in my case.

review.itemreviewed: Divide 5 GTX Trail Running Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: Great traction, support and fit! This is my fourth pair of these shoes...Clearly, I'm a fan!
review.name: Repeat customer, here!

review.itemreviewed: Divide 5 GTX Trail Running Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: I completed the questions on the website to find my shoe match and went with the Divide 5 GTX. I like the excellent grip where I can switch between pavement and muddy paths, and whilst I haven’t tested out how waterproof these are, they’ve been fine through light drizzle. The hot-pink soles really stand out. I didn’t like the toe box - like a few reviews have said, it’s pretty solid. I have wide feet so the shoe feels tight at the bendy end, and I don’t imagine the shoe will stretch at all. I have orthotic half insoles to lift my arches, so my heels are slightly elevated - in an average shoe, this makes little difference, but in the Divide, it means the back of the shoe sits pretty low. I also don’t think these are helping my knee pain. These are nice shoes, but they aren’t quite the right fit for me. I know there is the Run Happy Promise, but it feels such a waste to send these back for inevitable disposal.
review.name: Mixed feelings and shoe fit would suit some people

name: Divide 5 GTX Trail Running Shoe - Women's

hasVariant.description: Buy the Assos Mille GT Spring/Fall Knicker - Men's online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I think this is the best spring/fall knicker around. Great fit and the chamois is wonderful!
review.name: Great Spring/Fall Knicker

review.reviewBody: Really good for those 40-55 degrees das
review.name: Great fit, soft against the skin

review.reviewBody:
I wanted to take the time to review these excellent knickers because the fit is a bit confusing at first. 

For reference, I am 6' 3.5" and the recommended size for me from the Assos website is XL. Like a previous reviewer, the first time I put them on, and even after a few rides, I thought they must be too small. The chamois just seemed like it was too far forward, and wasn't covering my saddle area and did not reach to my sit bones. 

What I found is that you need to take a second to pull the lycra up onto your thigh, and then the fit is great, with the lycra extending just over the knee and the chamois in the right place. 

So, the moral of the story is....pull up your knickers kids.
review.name: Excellent Kickers....FYI on sizing

review.reviewBody:
As a senior 6-0 ft 180# cyclist, I  found the fit on these bibs in a size L a bit strange.
I've worn many size L high-end cycling bibs over the years, some fitting better than others.
This Assos Mille pair was noticeably short waisted on this old bod, but the real deal breaker was the chamois placement. The GT C2 seat pad is of excellent quality with a well-thought design. The problem is in the placement. The "floating" sides allow plenty of codpiece comfort and thigh protection, but the rear portion comes up short. I found that my sit bones rode slightly on & off the end of the pad. 
I'll try a larger size before I give up on these otherwise excellent quality knickers.
review.name: Good product . . .  except for sizing

review.reviewBody: This is my 3rd piece from Assos (first set of bibs) and I can't see myself buying other brands any longer. The quality is astounding. My only qualm when buying was sizing. The MILLE GT Jacket ULTRAZ Winter I bought, I had to size WAY up and the Skinfoil Winter Long-Sleeve Base Layer is very form fitting and I probably could go up one size (my normal size is medium). I ended up going with a medium. When you receive your bibs, it is very well packaged. I tried them on right away and had to struggle just a bit to get them over my thighs. I have other bibs from Specialized and Pearl Izumi and these ride a bit lower in the waist. It is more of a different feeling than anything. I love the straps. They are wide and very comfortable. The padding is very thick and comfortable. I did contemplate returning them for a large given the struggle to pull over my thighs. However, I decided to try them out on a ride or two to see if anything changed. I will say after a few rides, these are easier to pull on and they are so comfortable on the bike.
review.name: Another top notch item from Assos

name: Mille GT Spring/Fall Knicker - Men's

hasVariant.name: Helios Sun Hat

hasVariant.name: Helios Sun Hat
hasVariant.description: Buy the Outdoor Research Helios Sun Hat online or shop all Accessories from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I have owned seven of these hats counting the four I just ordered in multiple colors. There is no better hat made!
review.name: No Better Sun Hat Made!

review.reviewBody: This hat provides the right amount of sun protection out on the lake kayaking. It fits snug enough and with the chin sinch cord I feel confident it wont blow away on a windy lake Ontario day.
review.name: Great sun protection for kayaking on the lake

review.reviewBody: I like the weight of this hat and I bought one for my husband and one for me. His hat looks fine on him and the brim lies flat, but no matter what I attempt on my hat, (blocking, bending, stretching), I can't get the brim to lie flat and the hat just looks ridiculous. I think there is something wrong with the way my Helios was made. I plan to return it and get another one.
review.name: Brim won't lay flat...looks ridiculous

review.reviewBody: I bought this for a vacation and it did great and continues to do well.
review.name: Great sun protection, travels well.

review.reviewBody: This is the most versatile sun hat I have owned. It is my go to for mowing the lawn to beach and/or mountain vacations. I have two different colors. The hat is well made, and comfortable.
review.name: Helios Sun Hat

review.reviewBody: I have one of these from 2009. Still in great shape. Excellent sun protection for the ears and neck as well as the face.
review.name: Good investment

review.reviewBody: I just got back from three weeks in Peru—in the Andes and in the jungle. I needed a sturdy hat to protect my head from the sun that still looked good. This hat was just what I had been looking for. It kept its shape no matter how I stuffed it into my bag, and withstood all the elements I encountered. I definitely recommend it, and will be taking it on all my adventures from now on.
review.name: Just what I needed

review.reviewBody: Love this hat. This is my daily go-to except for bad rain, when I use the Seattle Sombrero. Brim is wide enough to give decent face and neck sun protection, but light enough to wear all day long. The brim is semi-formable and doesn't flop much at all. The only real issue with the hat is sizing. You really need to try them on, aa even in same sizing, head circumference varies a lot and is not consistent. Also varies significantly based on color. Easy to do if you buy it in-person, but I wouldn't buy online unless you're okay with possibly going through a return/exchange process. Would gladly buy again and likely will if I ever lose this one.
review.name: Great Hat - only 1 real issue

review.reviewBody: I wore this hat for my first time on a nine hour hiking trip. It was comfortable from the minute I put on and the brim was big enough to shade my face and back of neck from the sun. Love the hat. Love the colors.
review.name: Great fit. Maximum Comfort

review.reviewBody: I love this hat, but hate that I have to select a bunch of different hats in the same size and try them on to see which one has been put together in the actual size I wear and which one has either been sewn together in the wrong size or mis-stitched. Because of the sizing issue, along with the fact that I live far from an Outdoor Research retailer, I have to give up on this hat. I need to be able to order a hat and receive it in the size it's labeled with.
review.name: Inconsistent sizing and stitching

name: Helios Sun Hat

review.reviewBody: I bought this “waterproof” hip pack because I’m a paddler and get wet.  We were out about 90 minutes in rainy conditions yesterday and some things in the hip pack were wet.   Not as wet as with other gear, but still it was disappointing.
review.name: Not completely waterproof

review.reviewBody: Great bag, fits everything I need to carry daily. Strap is nice and thick, bag wraps and fits really well around the body. So far I absolutely love it.
review.name: Plenty of space, love it!

review.reviewBody: Works great! Brought it to Mexico and it ended up getting stolen. Hoping to buy another soon.
review.name: Perfect for travel

review.reviewBody: i bought this bag in June 2023 and love it.  Perfect size and so convenient. I wish it came in more colours.
review.name: Great bag

review.reviewBody: I got this bag for running around to do errands and hold stuff so my hands are free and I don't way down my pockets with stuff and this bag goes the trick and then some. I like the bigger size of the bag as it hold more stuff and bigger items the most sling bags.
review.name: Great Bag for everyday running around

review.reviewBody: I love my large hip pack! I mostly use it over the shoulders when I ride my bike. It fit everything I need and is completely waterproof! I want with the dark lava color and planning to get the red gold for this summer. I love it!

There's so much to like about this hip pack. It's large enough to carry all of my essentials with plenty of space leftover for snacks! The straps on the bottom can actually hold my water bottle, so it's perfect for light hiking with little to carry. Plus, its super water resistant!
review.name: Not Your Average Hip Pack

review.reviewBody: I got this for my stepdad and he loves it. It's a little more masculine than the kanken stuff, but still that classic Fjallraven style and phenomenal quality. He uses it on walks and hikes and can carry an extra layer with the compression straps.
review.name: More versatile looking hip pack

review.reviewBody: This is a great hip pack! It is light weight and very spacious! I can fit everything I need in it and love that I can wear it as a hip pack or over the shoulders. It is waterproof and keeps everything dry even in the heaviest rain. Love the colors and label on it too!
review.name: Favorite Hip Pack

review.reviewBody: My wife loves this. She uses it every time we travel, hike, or camp. This has been great especially now that our family is growing and she need hands free from a purse.
review.name: Fantastic Pack

name: Ulvo Large 4L Hip Pack

review.reviewBody: Style was a 5 out of 5, but the boot was too narrow. I do not have wide feet, so I was highly surprised.
review.name: TOO Narrow
comment: Hello edwbry, thank you for taking the time to leave us feedback. We’re sorry that our MAC HILL™ Lite Mid Plus Men's Waterproof Sneaker is hard to size. We’re happy to help assist with the issue if you will reach out to our Customer Care team at (888) My-SOREL. Thank you.

review.itemreviewed: Mac Hill Lite Mid Plus WP Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: Very lightweight yet durable! Easy to wear all day.
review.name: Great mix of comfort, durability, protection

review.itemreviewed: Mac Hill Lite Mid Plus WP Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody:
Bought these on line. The soles are made of super light memory type foam. This makes them super soft to walk in, actually far too soft for boots. 
They have also start to wear down in the sole after just a few miles and one use. I don’t think they are going to be durable and they’ll only last for 3-4 months of regular use, at best. I’d expect much more at this price and from Sorel. Very disappointing all round.
review.name: Soft and sole wearing after one outing

review.itemreviewed: Mac Hill Lite Mid Plus WP Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: Warm, comfortable and durable. These are my go to boots in the winter when you’re out and about. They so “scuff”a bit but it really isn’t an issue, but just a heads up on that.
review.name: Go to boots

name: Mac Hill Lite Mid Plus WP Boot - Men's

review.reviewBody: I purchased these recently in the purple color that was on sale. I love them! I live in Maine and we don't have much snow yet,  but, we have bad walking conditions and these have a great sole. Nice and toasty. Easy pull on and off.
review.name: Comfortable and warm
comment: Thanks so much for your wonderful review!

review.reviewBody: I love these shoes. They are super comfortable, cushion my feet nicely, and are warm in the coldest weather. They have good grip on snow and in icy conditions. For me, they run true to size. I love that they are slip-ons I can easily step into when taking the dog outside or going for a walk.
review.name: Great winter shoes!
comment: Thank you for your feedback. We're happy you love them!

review.reviewBody: Such a good lightweight warm shoe.  Just right for bopping around town during the winter months when you don't want to pull up a snow boot.  True to size and good tread.
review.name: Good lightweight warm shoe

review.reviewBody: I love these shoes they’re great, warm and easy to slip on
review.name: I love these shoes they’re great
comment: Thank you, Keri!

review.reviewBody: I bought these last year and they saved me in our snow/ice storm they cut into the ice and kept me from slipping they have great traction we live on a farm and they beat out my other winter boots. I give them a A+ for winter wear and they keep my feet dry and cosy. I now own 3 pairs.
review.name: Great Traction and Comfort

review.reviewBody: Found these on a clearance rack in the store.  Added insoles I purchased there.  They are perfect!  I wear an 11, hard to find in store.  They fit great.  Love the wide toe box.  It was a return and is a bit scuffed but otherwise new.
review.name: Great for walking the dogs

review.reviewBody: I like the way they look but one foot feels too loose
review.name: Merrill mov

review.reviewBody: I have been searching for some shoes to just wear around the house.  These are perfect!!!  Sizing was true, well cushioned with plenty of support.  I have plantar fasciitis, so shoes are really important for me.  I Love these shoes!!
review.name: So comfortable

review.reviewBody: This is a slipper upgrade.  Cozy.  Slip on.  No need to worry about traction with the Vibram sole.  I have 3 pairs of these.  No shame in wearing these out in public!
review.name: Slipper Upgrade
comment: Thank you for sharing your feedback with us.

review.reviewBody: Great slip on for those cold days without snow. Comfortable walking shoes with good grip for icy sidewalks.
review.name: Warm and comfy
comment: Thank you for sharing your review with us!

hasVariant.name: Chasqui 13L Sling Pack
hasVariant.description: Buy the Cotopaxi Chasqui 13L Sling Pack online or shop all Accessories from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Chasqui 13L Sling Pack
hasVariant.description: Buy the Cotopaxi Chasqui 13L Sling Pack online or shop all Accessories from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Great quality, easy fit, extremely functional. Just like I've come to expect from Cotopaxi. . . an excellent purchase.
review.name: As Expected

review.reviewBody: I bought these bags back in July and there are zero signs of wear or tear still yet. The lemongrass color was so much better in person once it arrived that I had to buy another as a gift. I personally carry the graphite color. I first made it my camp/hike bag and the clip at the bottom makes it super convenient to hang on a tree limb at a camp site while you enjoy the view and while on a hike I was able to fill this with 8 bottles of water, enough space for everyone's things! (However if you like to pack mule things like myself you might want to get the 2 strap version instead.) The variety of pockets keeps you organized and your things separated so you know exactly where to go each time, plus keep your electronics safe from cold drink condensation. I use this as my go to travel bag for any vacation. With the change of the season I have now made this my daily commute bag and I am so thankful it fits all my essentials plus my tupperware and Camelbak cup so now no need to juggle it all in my hands, plus the almost suite case like opening can make it easy to access it all at once. Cotopaxi's durability is beyond measure! Thanks Backcountry for making our matching gift bookbags hold memories for years to come!
review.name: Bought 3

review.reviewBody: I have only used the bag for one trip so far, so I was still learning how to use it compared to the previous bag I was using, but it has lots of great, versatile, secure storage compartments and the flexible configurations of the sling strap, as well as the padding, make it very comfortable to wear.
review.name: Great so far

review.reviewBody: Cotopaxi's main attribute have been the palette of bright colors. The Cada Dia doesn't have the renown orange and red, so it must stand on its functional merits. Sling packs are usually small to wear comfortably facing back or at the front. This sling offers ample thickness, width and height, unlike anything else on the market. It's one-of-a-kind with a purpose. I believe it lives up to Cotopaxi's ambitions.
review.name: Large for a Compact Sling

review.reviewBody: Bought this pack for the style, design, color, and size (in addition to a few other products). It is perfect for everyday use when I am on the run. I am pleasantly surprised by the quality of Cotopaxi's products. Please do not change in your level of quality. Awesome products I absolutely love!
review.name: Chasqui 13L Sling - Cada Día

review.reviewBody: Was just what I needed. Small enough to not weigh me down, big enough to hold most everything I needed and my laptop!
review.name: Love my new pack

review.reviewBody: I absolutely love this new cross body sling bag. Great for carrying necessary kid items while maintaining full use of both arms while leaning forward to tend to someone's needs.
review.name: Great Bag

review.reviewBody: Perfect for carrying on the front of my chest while I carry a larger “carry on” pack on my back. Good duo to maximize storage space while not being overloaded with one giant backpack.
review.name: Perfect for carrying on the

review.reviewBody: My first sling pack. Very comfort and versatile during a week trip to Kauai. No issues with hiking, shopping and to the beach. Just the right size for my leisurely trip.
review.name: Chasqui 13L Sling - Cada Día.

review.reviewBody: This is the first time I bought a Cotopaxi. I was searching for a high quality stylish bag. This bag exceeds expectations. It is a bag you will carry with you everywhere.
review.name: Amazing brand

name: Chasqui 13L Sling Pack

description: Buy the USWE Outlander Pro Hydration Backpack online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Outlander Pro Hydration Backpack
hasVariant.description: Buy the USWE Outlander Pro Hydration Backpack online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Outlander Pro Hydration Backpack
hasVariant.description: Buy the USWE Outlander Pro Hydration Backpack online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: The pack sits high on the back, which is a problem if you like to extend your torso forward on the bike in a typical road position. It's a lot of weight in a bad spot. Regular backpacks sit low on the back.
review.name: Too much weight on the upper back

review.reviewBody: The pack is light and unobtrusive. It sits very stable with no shifting or bouncing even on very rough washboard. I wish it had adjustability on the shoulder straps as it does tend to slip down slightly. I remedied that by sewing the straps and it sits nicely now. However, the chest straps are adjustable and have elastic built-in making them very comfortable and won't restrict your breathing.  It does make your upper back sweat but I because it sits so high on your back you really don't notice it. I have only ridden in temps around 80 and in the sun but once you're riding, you hardly notice it's there. The nice thing is it’s much easier to hydrate while riding, especially on roads that require hands on the bar. I find I drink more often too.   I can eliminate the need for just about 3, 24 oz (the pack holds 70) water bottles which is quite a savings in watts due to drag and its pretty much the same weight as the 3 bottles (~300 grams). In recent aero tests by Dylan Johnson and Silca, the pack actually saved a few watts as well. The hydration bladder is great, it's very easy to fill and cleaning is super easy as you can turn it inside out to clean and dry. The bite valve works flawlessly, providing a high flow. Overall, it’s a great pack.
review.name: Stable, comfortable &  works as promise

name: Outlander Pro Hydration Backpack

review.reviewBody: Love it.  I'm 5'8" 150lbs and usually wear a medium.  I got a small and fits perfect for a vest.  The neck line is a differentiator here and is runs to the bottom of my nose.  Waist pulls inside both pockets.  2 pockets on the inside is a nice touch.  No funky zippers.

review.reviewBody: This is a really great vest and especially the design is perfet as it is sleek, functional and provides both warmth and protection for the shoulders. review.reviewBody: First off I'd recommend going a size down if you're planning on wearing this with light and thin underlayers, but if you're wanting to wear it with thicker items like the Canada Shirt, I'd go with your true size. The main feature I love about this vest is how it does not pill easily. I'm pretty hard on my clothing and wear things out quickly, but this vest really holds up. It's got plenty of pockets that make it a worthy travelling vest, and the G-1000 on the shoulders ensures that you won't wear through them while carrying a bag or heavy load. This piece also keep you just warm enough without being too heavy.
review.name: Last vest I'll ever want

description: Buy the Helly Hansen Odin Mountain Infinity 3L Jacket - Men's online or shop all Clothing from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Odin Mountain Infinity 3L Jacket - Men's
hasVariant.description: Buy the Helly Hansen Odin Mountain Infinity 3L Jacket - Men's online or shop all Clothing from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I've been wearing this shell for the last few weeks of a Chicago winter/spring and found it to be a versatile piece between layering a fleece or down puffer. It's windproof and waterproof as designed. The material is interesting, with almost a brushed finish that's also stiff which  reminds me of a waxed cotton jacket, but it seems to be breaking in nicely. The hood adjustments are nice but the drawstrings have no cinching capability and seem to stay in place only by friction. The cuffs have a hook/loop strap that works fine. The elastic drawstring at the bottom hem is elastic and can only be adjusted from one side. The problem is that after you pull the drawstring, it's nearly impossible to pull it back out (took about 20 minutes). The fit is on the athletic/slim side and longer than what the picture would indicate. It's definitely a parka style, not a jacket. Overall, the look is pretty cool and the black on black logo is a nice touch.  Five stars minus one star for the bottom hem drawstring. Make this into a jacket length and add retention tabs to the hood drawstring and fix the bottom drawstring and I might have to buy another one.
review.name: Almost perfect

review.reviewBody:
So I bought the Helly Hansen Odin 9 Worlds Infinity 3L Jacket last year (which is more of a general hardshell) than snowsport specific and I think I'm going with that one instead of this one, which is a shame.

Fit/form factor: I love the HH grey fog color and that's why I bought these 2.  But this particular one is a bit wider and longer than the Odin 9 world, which makes me look a bit big.  I get it, bigger for wider range of motion for snow sports.   But the bigger issue is that bad design of the snow skirt.  It's 2 hooks on each side.  I'm 160 lbs and need it at the smallest position, and when I do that, because of the wideness of the jacket, it just bunches out and looks dumb.  And the skirt is still not very tight even at the tightest position.  It's also definitly wider then the HH crew jackets.

Additionally, this does not have any wrist gaiters - which kinda forces you to get over the cuff gloves.  You'd imagine that's basically a requirement for ski/snowboard jacket.  Descente includes them so definitely it's not a skill based thing.  Even so, without it, I wonder if I can take it to extreme environements as the goal also is to keep wind out (not just snow)

I do like that this one has several inside pockets as well as more common sense outside pockets compared to the Odin 9 world.  Also the hood for this one is BIGGER than the 9world, which is a good thing because it actually makes it helmet compatible, unlike the 9 world, which doesn't really fit properly if you have a big head and have a big helmet.

-----

Haven't tested this one outdoors yet, but since it's HH, I'm buying it more for the style than the function.  I bought the Odin 9 world grey fog pants, but one of the small buttons popped just from trying it on and unbuttoning, so I'm not really trusting this brand to hold up in the long run.   Had to return that one.   Additionally, people tend to question HHs waterproof ability.

But I know that and I'm just here to get a stylish grey jump suit.  I think for now I'll just keep the Odin 9 jacket and buy snow pants with a bib to keep snow out.  Don't feel like going with Montec for style lol

Still waiting for trustworthy HH grey fog snow pants (with gaiters)...  And maybe a grey helmet that matches  - eying some giros
review.name: Eh, probably designed for...not sure who
comment: I think this jacket is more for mountaineering and climb

name: Odin Mountain Infinity 3L Jacket - Men's

review.reviewBody: Can't comment on how warm it is as it's summer, but it's incredibly comfortable! Really is worth carrying the extra bulk for the comfort and looking forward to trying out in cooler weather.
review.name: Can't comment on how warm

review.reviewBody: Great night’s sleep comfortable for a side sleeper like myself and really warm too
review.name: Great night’s sleep comfortable for

review.reviewBody:
I'll start by saying that the pad itself is decent. The only big downside to me is that the baffling structure is made up of straight lines, making it a bit less comfortable than those with more of a hexagonal shape. But I'd say that's somewhat of a minor discomfort as someone who sleeps on their back and doesn't move much in their sleep anyways. And well... you're camping. You're not in a luxury hotel bed and don't expect the best sleep of my life. And I'm okay with that.

However, the biggest downside to this pad has been something I never really considered before... And I'll preface by saying I've used a number of stuff sacks in my day. I'm in the backcountry to some degree most weekends of the year. I know how to properly pack down a self-inflating pad and get it into it's stuff sack. But HOLY MOLY this pad is so hard to get into it's unique little sack. I do genuinely like the design they went for with for the little bag, it's unique!! And a cooler concept that stuffing something in from the top down (this one has a sideways opening + elastic bad closure) - but GOODNESS it is SMALL. It needs like an extra millimeter or two of fabric to make it easier. I'd rather the bag be bigger and then have compression straps to squish it down. You really have to get *all* of the air out of the pad, which is not impossible and I've only gotten better at it with practice, but it's still a struggle. As I'm packing up camp I go "oh well, I'll worry about this when I get home. Everyone else is already packed up." It seems like such a small issue, but it's been infuriating for some reason (and I'd say I'm a really patient person in general, so I don't know why this little thing is such a bother). As someone who tends to pack their backpacking pack pretty chock-full, having a piece of gear in there that isn't quite wrapped up properly, makes my backpack all wonky and is just a bit frustrating. And in the winter... forget it! I did get this pad because the R value was high enough for all year use, but I can see myself getting infuriated with cold fingers or gloves on trying to pack this thing up. I picked it up at the beginning of summer, so we'll see how that goes.

Anyways, I'm not typically one to leave reviews anywhere, but I'm hoping this feedback gets back to Rab and they can improve on the next iteration. I know they're new to pads, so I took a risk in purchasing this one (I didn't see too many reviews out yet when I purchased this right around the time it launched). It's a minor issue, and I'm sure they'll improve in the future! 

I'd also like to say that I do appreciate the elephant's eyes on the pump sack! So fun and cute! We love a product with thoughtful design! As well as the pump sack's general shape/functional design. And I do like that they tried something different with the actual stuff sack too! They are on to something - it's just a hare too small.

I'd also say that this pad is pretty heavy. But it's my first real winter pad, so I guess that's expected. I'm in great shape, and certainly not an ultralighter at this point in my life. (But I am getting to the age where my back/scoliosis is thinking it might be time soon) So if you don't need the R-value warmth, and are packing your things in on your back, it might be worth getting a lighter pad for summer (depending on the climate/altitude you camp in).

Would I purchase it again? Honestly, I picked this up on sale, as a cheaper alternative to the Xtherm - and I kind of wish I'd had the money to splurge on that one instead. It seems more comfortable and a staple in most people's gear, and like they've worked out all the kinks. ...but it's twice the price, even without the sale. I've also slept on some of my friends' Big Agnes insulated pads, and have *loved* those! Comfy, insulated, and less pricey than the Therma.

Hope this helps someone!
review.name: Decent pad - awful stuff sack.

review.reviewBody: I actually have the Ionosphere 5.5 Sleeping Mat (690g) and it’s amazing! Long and wide…
review.name: I actually have the Ionosphere

review.reviewBody: The mat itself is very good, comfortable and well insulated. However to storage back is impractical as the mat only fits with it perfectly rolled, something that is virtually impossible in anything other than perfect conditions
review.name: The mat itself is very

review.reviewBody:
Great sleeping mat, took it to Iceland recently and was around 1°c and it kept me warm all night, it’s very comfortable. 

There’s a couple of downsides, not major ones at all but the mat it quite noisy when you’re moving round on it which on previous mats I’ve had hasn’t been a problem. 
The other is they’re also a bit bulkier when packed up than the competition with the same R-value, not massively bulkier just a little. Overall I’m very happy with it.
review.name: Great sleeping mat, took it

name: Stratosphere 5.5 Sleep Pad

hasVariant.description: Buy the ION K-Pact Select Knee Pad online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
I got these about 2 years ago and have worn them on rides about once a week, with a couple of crashes here and there. I take out the internal knee pad pieces and run them through the washer every 2-3 months or so, then line dry. Sometimes I'll just rinse them off and line dry if needed. 

Pros: 
- they aren't slip-on, which was one of my top criteria
- they aren't too hot even in 100*+ Texas heat
- I don't really notice the bulk when riding
- they provide good protection and a lot of coverage on my shins too, have landed directly on my knees 2-3 times and didn't even bruise. They also do a good job of blocking cactus spines!

Cons:
- they look super bulky on
- the elastic straps have lost some of their elasticity and I'm now constantly having to pull them up; they slip down nearly every time I ride because I can no longer get them tight enough
- the velcro also seems to be wearing down and the bottom strap comes loose easily
- the mesh fabric on the side has gotten caught on my pedal pegs more times than I want to count and is all ripped up now; even pulled out one of the side seam bindings, so they look pretty trashed

Overall, I'm glad I bought these when I was first starting out; they helped me feel more confident on the trail. But I am bummed at how much they've worn out in 2 years (although some of that could be due to how I care for them - not sure, as I don't see any care instructions provided).
review.name: Did the job but wear out fast

review.reviewBody: Sure they look cool. Sure they're really comfortable when riding. But when it comes to an impact, they're not worth much. My first impact and my right knee was hamburger! Used for mountain unicycling. I've used and abused numerous knee/shin sets over the years and these are definitely not worth the high price tag. Unfortunately, like Firefly, my go to set was discontinued.
review.name: Great if you never actually use them

review.reviewBody:
Bought these for the SO who likes to do enduro-style riding. He chose them specifically because they're NOT a slip-on style and he can ride up with them in his bag, then put them on at the top without taking off his shoes.  

He loves the fit and feel of them when riding BUT ON THE FIRST RIDE this little side anchor strap pulled out on his first crash!  This piece is anchor for the webbing strap that goes under the knee (has the velcro on one side and a hook on the other).  The stitching along this seam appears to be coming out now, so I think this was just a manufacturing defect and they didn't stitch it in properly (looks like there was no back-stitch along the seam).  

This was a repairable issue, albeit a little tricky to hold it together while flipping the pad inside out through to access it through the small slit where the SAS-TEC pad comes out.  I've stitched it back into that seam, and gone along the seam and reinforced it with some extra back stitching.  

Have heard from other people that they had the same issue with these pads, and the exact same strap pulled out. They have continued to ride with the pads and haven't had any problems if that strap isn't connected. To be honest, we aren't really sure why this webbing is there in the first place and what its purpose is!  If you do decide to get these, DON'T TIGHTEN THE WEBBING TOO MUCH. We think that when he crashed, the neoprene went to stretch but the webbing didn't and so that became the high stress point and that's why it pulled out.   *shrugs*

Overall 5/5 for fit and performance, but -1 star for this piece falling apart on the first fall. Would expect better from something that's >$100.
review.name: Fits great, but one flimsy strap

name: K-Pact Select Knee Pad

review.reviewBody: After trying a few different packs, this is the one that fits my dog.  The pack has a bunch of adjustments to get things dialed in and keeps in place. I haven't noticed any rubbing or irritation from my dog.  It has more than enough space for what he'll be carrying.   Added benefit.. the mesh panels will soak up water and work like a cooling vest when he dips in a stream. The pockets seem to be water resistant and I haven't had any of the interior space get wet.   It seems well made and has held up, but when it does eventually wear out I will be getting another Mountainsmith K9 pack.
review.name: Best fitting pack for my dog

name: K-9 Pack

review.reviewBody: This is pretty much the most inaccurate picture of a product I've ever seen.  It looks as if I was wearing a shiny blue garbage bag. review.reviewBody: I love the color combination on this jacket! It's lightweight but insulated enough to keep you warm on a chilly and/or windy day. The quality is great and that's why I keep coming back to Cotopaxi! It's a little on the bigger size- not that I'm complaining. It'll fit perfect if you layer under for colder days.
review.name: Amazing Jacket

review.reviewBody: My son loves his Capa jacket. He was very happy with the colors and wears it all the time. . . even in the house! Great product!
review.name: Love the Capa Kids Jacket

review.reviewBody: Ordered a size XL, fits a woman 5’2” 140lbs normally a S/M. Little snugger at hips than I would prefer, but still fits well.
review.name: Great style and fit!

review.reviewBody: Our whole family bought Cotopaxi jackets this fall based on a friend’s recommendation of how warm and lightweight they were and how easy to pack. I LOVE that we have warm jackets that are easy to travel with!
review.name: Will Definitely Buy Again

review.reviewBody: My daughter loves this jacket and that it is reversible! I recommend it!
review.name: Looks sharp and fits great!

review.reviewBody: Light weight, fun styling, and perfect for daily wear going in and out of buildings at school
review.name: Perfect jacket

review.reviewBody: The first time I wore the jacket it was really windy and I was still warm
review.name: The first time I wore

review.reviewBody: This is the perfect jacket for our Georgia fall weather. My son loves it.
review.name: Awesome coat!

review.reviewBody: This jacket is lightweight but warm. My daughter loves the colors and flexibility it has for cross country skiing. Looks great on both sides!
review.name: Great jacket!

name: Capa Insulated Jacket - Kids'

review.reviewBody: It runs small, I am returning
review.name: Vest

review.reviewBody: Well cut, beautiful vest.  i bought my usual size 4. It fits well and will have no problem with wearing a sweater, thicker ones too.   I am tall, 5'7, with a 34A bust, broad shoulders, back and thin arms.  This vest can be unzipped from the bottom up, an added feature which makes sitting comfortable.   All zipped up it is snug and toasty.
review.name: Very Happy

review.reviewBody: I own another two of these vests. They are warm and elegant, well made. If you aren’t familiar with Barbour, it’s pretty much standard to size up. I gave this particular vest 4 stars because the burnt clay is a more muted color than I expected.
review.name: Great vest

review.reviewBody: I love these Barbour vests, they are the highest quality. But I agree with other reviewers that they fit small. Plus I inadvertently ordered a UK size so that was really small. My only other complaint is that the return label was not easy to print, it was too small and I had to fiddle with it to get the right scale.
review.name: Great quality, definitely fits small

review.reviewBody: On the recommendation of other reviews, I ordered one size larger than my usual size. Even over my thickest sweater the vest is still HUGE, and adjusting the snaps to a tighter fit did not help enough. I should have listened to the general Google reviews that said this vest run large (not small, Backcountry reviewers!). Although the style is nice, I’m afraid to reorder in a smaller size in case it is still too big.
review.name: Does NOT run small

review.reviewBody: Really like the fit and looks of this.   Originally purchased in olive, bought a second in brown.  I can't wear barbour items with sleeves at all, my shoulders are too big, but the vest seems to work fine.
review.name: I love it, bought a second one

review.reviewBody: The Barbour Wray Gilet vest runs small, especially through shoulders and waist. I normally take a sz 6 but had to go up two sizes. This vest looks great, casual yet polished and classy. Perfect for cooler fall and spring days layered on top of a sweater. Can't wait to wear it out!
review.name: Love this vest

name: Wray Gilet Vest - Women's

description: Buy the Spy Marauder SE Goggles online or shop all Ski from Backcountry.com.
color: Juneshine Happy Bronze Gold+LL Yellow Green

hasVariant.color: Juneshine Happy Bronze Gold+LL Yellow Green
hasVariant.name: Marauder SE Goggles
hasVariant.description: Buy the Spy Marauder SE Goggles online or shop all Ski from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: This is as much a review of Backcountry as it is for the Spy Marauder SEs. Not much impressed with either. Ordered the Seafoam/ turquoise lenses, which appear to be frosted, as do other goggles in the Marauder lineup. They are NOT frosted, they are plain old mirrors, nothing special there. It turns out that the SE does not stand for special edition, it means SMALL EDITION. Here's where BC screwed up, After I placed my order(within a half hour of placing order) I realized the mistake and called a gearhead so I could change my order to the  (regular sized) Marauder but she assured me the "one size" that I had ordered WAS the larger Marauder. Sadly disappointed when they arrived but I'm not going to pay to return them. I pulled the clear film out and I'm sure BC wouldn't give full refund price, not worth the hassle.
review.name: Misrepresentation all the way around

name: Marauder SE Goggles

description: Buy the Zipp Goodyear/Zipp XPLR SLICK Tubeless Tire online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Goodyear/Zipp XPLR SLICK Tubeless Tire
hasVariant.description: Buy the Zipp Goodyear/Zipp XPLR SLICK Tubeless Tire online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
Found it is extremely hard to install the tire on Zipp 303 XPLR SW wheels. I installed quite a few tires recently on quite a few wheels. And none of them are as hard as this one. Not even close.

There are three steps to install a tire: 1. put the wheel in between two tire beads, 2. install first bead, 3. install the second bead.

Normally only the last step is challenging. But for this tire which I bought two, I can't complete the step 2 on one, and can't do step 1 on the other after lost 3 fingerprints on my hand. Never see this before. I start to doubt if this tire is truly developed with the wheels as they claimed. I won't say this is purely caused by this tire (the wheel is very wide), but since it only works with 303 XPLR, I had to return it.

Schwalbe g one rs fixed my problem.
review.name: Very hard to install. And I gave up.

name: Goodyear/Zipp XPLR SLICK Tubeless Tire

description: Buy the Sea To Summit Frontier UL Collapsible Kettle online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Frontier UL Collapsible Kettle
hasVariant.description: Buy the Sea To Summit Frontier UL Collapsible Kettle online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Works great and has metal lid for durability. Using with the Soto G and Windmaster stoves with awesome performance.
review.name: Compact Kit

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I got this for free @Influenster and now for the honest review. I took it to go camping last week, it was portable and easy to use, using to boil water was as easy as it gets, the only problem I had with it, was that it had a smaller water capacity and I wish it was bigger. It was a quick boil though as it heats very quick.
review.name: It heats up quick

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Loving this as it is perfect for camping.  The kettle is very well made and sturdy.  Perfect size for two people and works well when heating up water or other liquids.  Water heats well and the heat is distributed well.  I love how it folds up so it makes it easy to pack and store.
review.name: Very usable kettle

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This is the best idea so far. We go camping every year and finding something that’s compact to use for boiling any water is a struggle. This bundles up so well and travels easily. The size is not too ideal as you can maybe boil 2 cups of water but, it’s so worth it. I was worried about how it would hold up to our camping stove but it did great. A definite addition to our camping trips. Even regular trips. The size and is perfect to put in a suitcase!
review.name: Camping and Travel Ready

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This is nice and compact, perfect for camping or hiking when you don’t want to bring a lot. It fits perfect in your backpack and it folds right up.!
review.name: Nice and compact

review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I received this kettle free for my honest review.
It's a cute little kettle. Seems to heat water fine. Not good for an open flame. Holds a good amount of water for tea.
review.name: Travel capability

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This product is created to save space while camping, the product has an amazing quality and it seems helpful. The packing is amazing it helps to protect the product 🙌  I recommend this brand for a long round-trip or a camping adventure 🧘🏽 oh and is easy to clean
review.name: Perfect for camping

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Frontier UL Collapsible kettle is so handy. You can go hiking, camping I love it. You also put it in your bag and close it back up. It keeps the heat very nice and warm. This is great for winter time to make a soup or keep the hot water warm.
review.name: Kettle

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Having a collapsible kettle is actually a great idea! I am always looking for space saving items to take along with me camping! And who doesn’t love a hot cup of coffee when they wake up in the morning especially when you can step outside your tent or camper and enjoy it outside with a view! It’s perfect!
review.name: Great addition to camping!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I used it for my tea and it works great I love it it warms it up perfectly and folds down for extra space this is exactly what I needed thank you so much 🤗
review.name: The best one so far

name: Frontier UL Collapsible Kettle
