review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I had to buy the biggest bag for our sleeping pads to get the needed length but there is a lot of excess width. Why can't they make a long narrow bag for sleeping pads? Don't people use roll up pads anymore? I don't want to use the bladder kind cause they can fail too easily. Otherwise, the best lightweight dry bag I could find. 
I have them in smaller sizes for the sleeping bags and that's fine.
review.name: Fine but wish they made a long, narrow bag for sleeping pads.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] An excellent dry bag for hiking, as it's very durable and weighs almost nothing. I highly recommend it for hiking!
review.name: Durable and ultra light weight

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Packing for a Kilimanjaro trip and the bags are light weight, flexible, and perfect for packing!
review.name: Great Dry Bags

review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Ultralite, well made, warranty offered, and reasonable prices.
Love you guys!!
review.name: Love my Dry Stuff Sacks

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Quick and compact for daily use. Works well and fits in your regular day bags.
review.name: Easy to use and Compact

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] So I'm currently using this sil dry bag as a bear bag with a nylofume liner. It is lighter than most bags for that purpose which is a huge plus and for the 3 times I've used it (once it rained) everything stayed dry inside the bag. It's easy to get things into and out of, and I know it's not designed for it but works well for hanging in a tree until my bearicade comes in.
review.name: Great piece of gear

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I love using dry bags for anytime I travel but especially for backpacking. I used my Ultra-sil dry bag on a trip on the Amazon river in Brazil and it performed as needed! All my stuff stayed dry and I liked having a bright color to differentiate from my other stuff/dry sacks.
review.name: Dry bag

review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The bags I purchased are light weight and good for a variety of uses: Canoe/ kayak = keeping my lunch dry;
Backpacking = carrying day gear to work site as an AT maintainer, picking up stuff off trail, hang bear bag ; Hiking = snacks and to go bag.
review.name: Dry Gear

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This 3L dry bag is perfect for organization while backpacking. I used to think I didn't need an organization system, but it makes all the difference for minimal weight. I store my toiletries, electronics (cables and battery pack), and other personal care items. Would highly recommend to anyone considering!
review.name: UL Dry Bag 3L

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Does exactly what it’s supposed to do. Keeps things dry while being incredibly light. There are other “lighter” options out there that I have tried. Nothing comes close to the durability to weight ratio that they have achieved with these dry bags.
review.name: Durable and UL… magic

name: Ultra-Sil Dry Bag

description: Buy the WHITESPACE SW Signature Puffy Jacket - Men's online or shop all Clothing from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: SW Signature Puffy Jacket - Men's
hasVariant.description: Buy the WHITESPACE SW Signature Puffy Jacket - Men's online or shop all Clothing from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I really like the coat, However; the cinch around the bottom is odd. There is no way to secure the drawstrings in order to assure that when cinched up that it will stay closed. Perhaps I am missing some thing, but both drawstring ends just have a loop. I don't get it. It's nice to be able to cinch the bottom of the coat closed so that the winter winds here in Iowa won't blow up inside the coat. I did email the manufacturer about my concerns, but they have never messaged me back (Rude). Other than that the coat is very comfortable and as long as it is warm this winter I have no other complaints. If anything, I guess I will just tie the draw strings together if need be, which I'm sure I will when it's windy outside while I'm cleaning the previous nights snow off of my car.
review.name: Nice Coat

name: SW Signature Puffy Jacket - Men's

review.reviewBody: I purchased two pairs and the colors are great and add spice to any kit. The material is sturdy  but the calf sizing/foot is a bit off. I by no means have monster calves but these are difficult to pull up and over, and during a 2-3 hour ride they do tend to slip down.
review.name: Creative Colors

review.reviewBody: First time trying DeFeet. Was excited to add another pair of funky socks to my collection. Quality seemed par for a cycling sock. However, the cuff does not have a whole lot of stretch, dare I say none. I struggled to get pull them on and knew they weren't the right fit. I have bigger calves and after a long ride that restriction is no good. if you are more of the Euro fit they are probably great.
review.name: Cool sock for the right fit

review.reviewBody: I wear a US size 14 and an XL fits great with these socks. Hold us well as I have had a few pair for over a year now. Somewhat hard to get on, but feel great on foot. The part that goes up your leg is somewhat sturdy and feels secure.
review.name: I have come back for more pairs twice!

review.reviewBody: These socks are just what I wanter.  They came quickly, fit well, and look sharp.
review.name: Great Socks

name: Aireater 6in Sock

review.reviewBody: Super soft and comfortable! I definitely will be purchasing more colors!
review.name: Love!

review.reviewBody: Most other tops from FF I wear a medium but this tank top the small is the right fit. Great fabric and length.
review.name: Comfy and perfect cut

review.reviewBody: These tanks are my go to. Love the soft feel and perfect under another top as nit bulky at all.
review.name: Racer Back is Awesome

review.reviewBody: I love these shirts. I just wish they were more durable. Putting on a seatbelt will cause the fabric to bead up where the belt hits the shirt.
review.name: Be careful

review.reviewBody: Cute/comfortable top. I originally purchased a medium, but it was too big. Exchanged for a small. Love the material. The shirt is a too long in my opinion. Needs to be an inch or two shorter. I like my shirts long, but these are too long. I give props for the length, because everyone these days feel like crop tops are the way. I am not a crop top person and I am very athletic. Great tank for all activities.
review.name: Nice tank

review.reviewBody: I like the top but don’t like that it shows any type of sweat. I will try a different color next time.
review.name: Nice Top

review.reviewBody: Bought one and loved it so much, came back for another. Soft, gently hangs and doesn’t cling and can forget you have it on. Bought it for - pickleball! Though I’m wearing it other times too!
review.name: Great

review.reviewBody: The material is so soft. Great for exercising, hiking, hanging out, really anything. Only downside is somehow got an oil? looking stain on it that didn't want to come out. Unsure what the stain is from but was wearing it while backpacking/camping on the beach, so maybe from sunscreen or something. I guess just be careful.
review.name: Great top

review.reviewBody: Love this racerback so much, i have it in two colors. Do i need to say its super comfy like all freefly clothes! well, it is! i love the simplicity of all of freefly clothes. my absolute favorite clothing company! :)
review.name: Racing to the finish!

review.reviewBody: I’m 5’4”, 130 lbs, 34D & a small fit me perfectly. Great tank for casual running around town or for the gym
review.name: Comfy tank

name: Motion Racerback Tank - Women's

description: Buy the Wahoo Fitness KICKR AXIS Upgrade Kit online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: KICKR AXIS Upgrade Kit
hasVariant.description: Buy the Wahoo Fitness KICKR AXIS Upgrade Kit online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I realized that my trainer already had this feature installed so I returned.
review.name: Action feet

review.reviewBody:
I cannot really feel any difference between the trainer with these feet installed versus the oem last gen feet,
But they are well made, very grippy, and supportive.
review.name: Well made, feels same as it ever was.

review.reviewBody: Really helped with sprinting and a more natural feel
review.name: Really helped with sprinting and

review.reviewBody: Better than the original feet but I don't feel a huge difference. Glad I have them but not worth the price.
review.name: They are okay.

review.reviewBody: If using an older Kickr on hard surface like basement concrete you'll appreciate these immediately.  At the CslC current price just grab them.  The side to side play is nice but also quieter and just less fatigue on long seated sections.
review.name: Great upgrade

review.reviewBody: I have a KIKR 2017 model and just added the Axis Action feet. I set them up for some slight side to side movement and they make the overall comfort on the KIKR significantly better. I started using SYSTM /WahooX shortly after getting the new feet and have been spending a lot more time on the KIKR. The Axis feet are a great addition.
review.name: KIKR Axis Action Feet

review.reviewBody:
I can’t really tell much of a difference with these on, but I needed a replacement set of feet, and it just made sense to give these a go. 
They are very well built and easy to install.
review.name: Nice feet

review.reviewBody: Did not need these as they were already installed on Kickr when it arrived
review.name: Did not need these as

review.reviewBody: The KICKR Axis Action Feet really do make riding in the basement a better experience. It is an upgrade that is definitely worth adding to your kicker. I wish it didn't cost so much, but now that I spent the money, it was money well spent.
review.name: Pricey, but worth it

review.reviewBody: I have had my trainer for several years and enjoy the way it functions. In an effort to add more realistic feel I added these feet to the trainer. They make the ride more enjoyable. It feels less like riding a trainer. The slight movement is much better than riding the trainer feeling like it’s anchored to the ground with a rigid frame. Best upgrades in order of pleasure/utility: wahoo fan, table to put iPad on, feet.
review.name: More enjoyable ride

name: KICKR AXIS Upgrade Kit

hasVariant.name: Outpost Frame Bag
hasVariant.description: Buy the Blackburn Outpost Frame Bag online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Nevermind that it fits perfectly nestled in between my frame, it’s a great looking bag and functional for what I need. The color also is better than what’s shown on the website. Advice: if you choose to carry a bladder in it, check out the bladders made for a hip pack. They seem to fit better. My small bag fits a 1.5L. If anyone has discovered a better bladder and you can somehow comment on this review, please let me know!
review.name: Best bag for my bike

review.reviewBody: I used this for two multi-day rides. One on a road bike and one on a MTB. I removed the bottle cages and had the bag fully extended. Used a camel back for hydration. This pack won't fit all MTBs depending upon how the rear shock is configured. I got it to work on my Giant Anthem. On my 54cm road frame, it fit fine. I liked having the small outside pockets for things I needed quick access to. There are a lot of straps to be able to secure it to your bike but it is easier to take out the items you need each night than to remove all the straps. You can't overstuff too much or your knees will hit the sides but I was fine with it. Seems well constructed, still in good shape.
review.name: Much better than having weight on back

review.reviewBody:
Great  frame  bag. Solid build, but the  sizing listed isn't the correct sizing. It is listed at 18" for the size med, but it comes in at 16.5".  That last  1.5" would really add a lot more capacity.

I love the  ability to unzip the bag when you need more  capacity. The  only  problem is that when the bag is really loaded up, the  bag  can  bulge out a bit and cause  some  rub on your legs.
review.name: Great  bag, runs small

name: Outpost Frame Bag

description: Buy the Volcom Solver Jean - Men's online or shop all Clothing from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Solver Jean - Men's
hasVariant.description: Buy the Volcom Solver Jean - Men's online or shop all Clothing from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
These pants are fantastic. I wore Levi's for years and years until they became too cheaply made to justify the price.

Volcom Jeans like the Solver or the Kinkade are expertly made, with many details to highlight their origin. There is a luxurious change pocket, a phantom left-hand pocket (essentially, a second pocket sown onto the left pant pocket). The rear pockets are well cut and allow my wallet to shift away from my rear when sitting down. The final touch is the fun asymmetric seams on the pant, and embroidered emblem on the pant leg.

I really love Volcom Jeans. I own three, plus a pair of Carhartt B18s for work. These jeans may not be super rugged, but they are comfortable to wear all day, don't chafe and make room for your squishy parts.
review.name: My Go-To Pair

name: Solver Jean - Men's

review.reviewBody: Took these on a rather technical 10-mile run as their maiden voyage. Not having any experience with the brand before but having strong preferences for durability, I can say I was pleasantly surprised. The cushioning in heel and stability is midsole were pretty fantastic. The wider footprint let me feel secure on uneven quick shifting terrain. The few jagged rocks that skimmed the sides of the shoe seemed to go unfazed. The only area of concern is the very front of the outsole tip where it seems the glue didn’t fully adhere giving way to a tiny lip. I’ll keep an eye on it but so far so good. For sizing, I typically were 10.5 in On Cloudultra with room in the toe box. I wear a 10 in dress shoes and Nike Killshot. These required me sizing up to an 11 because the 10.5 was cramped.
review.name: Solidly planted .. run a small-ish

review.reviewBody: I usually run trails in Altra, Topo, or Xero. These have amazing traction and a secure fit. I recommend a full size up as I normally wear 12 and went with a 13 here.
review.name: Great feel

review.reviewBody:
As others have said, size up. Correct fit for me was a 12 in these and I normally wear 10.5’s. 
Other than the sizing they seem pretty quality.
review.name: First impressions

review.reviewBody: Fits exactly how you would expect it to. Get up To An Extra 20% OFF discount from promo1024.com
review.name: Lightweight Agility

review.reviewBody: The build quality of these shoes is excellent.  Looking forward to testing their durability.  Super comfortable.  I went up a 1/2 size and they fit great.
review.name: Excellent build quality and comfort

review.reviewBody: Excellent design and quality, and super light - which you'd expect for such high-priced footwear. Beware of sizing however. On their website, Norda says go a half size up. I did, and it's still too small. You have to go up one full size or even a size and half to make them fit. Given that Backcountry charges you to return items (don't like that), it's best to try in store to tell for sure.
review.name: Excellent quality, light, runs SMALL

name: 002 Trail Running Shoe - Men's

review.reviewBody: Bought this pair to replace my 15 year old high top Bog's . The tread finally wore down on those and they caused me to slip and slide. I will keep them though because they fit into my snow shoes so easily! Love this "new" style with deeper tread. Looking forward to trying these out in the snow and ice. They also will be great for warmth sitting at snowy football games! I purchased the red colored ones. Very fun.
review.name: Comfortable/Versatile/And good color selections

review.reviewBody: My closet is full of bogs and my grandson is 13 and has worn nothing other than Bogs in our snowy WI winters. My recent purchase has been great because of the deeply grooved soles for our winter. Love my bogs!
review.name: Nothing better than a Bog!

review.reviewBody: These boots are great this is my second pair in five years. My feet never get cold or wet even after hours of outdoor activities
review.name: Great boots

review.reviewBody: Very happy with my new boots. I purchased them to walk the dogs and do outside chores in the winter.
review.name: Warm and comfortable!

review.reviewBody: This is my second pair of Bogs and my first pair for winter. They fit true to size, anre comfortable and I love the way they look. I haven't worn them in the snow yet and I'm in no hurry for winter weather but the treads look like something that will keep me dry and upright this year. I would definitely recommend a pair of Bogs no matter what the season. :)
review.name: Winter is Coming!

review.reviewBody: I bought these for my wife to use during the easier parts of winter and absolutely loves the comfort. She stated that she really didn't feel her feet getting cold unless she was just standing around. As long as she was moving, she said they were good
review.name: Wife loves the comfort

review.reviewBody: This is my second pair of Bogs and my first pair of winter boots. I'm not looking forward to the ice and snow but I know I'll be ready with these fabulous boots:)
review.name: Great Boots!!

review.reviewBody: This is my first Bogs purchase and overall, I am impressed. I did think the lining would be thicker and warmer but a good pair of wool socks can compensate for that. They are comfortable with a lot of cushion but, they are a little heavy. That will take some getting used to. I definitely recommend sizing up. Thank you Bogs!
review.name: Happy first time customer.

review.reviewBody: Excellent service, excellent boots. Warm, fabulous tread. Second pair! First pair lasted 3 years, 3 out of 4 seasons of full wear each year in Vermont. Highly recommend!
review.name: Bestest boots ever!

review.reviewBody: By far the best boot I have every owned. Rated down to minus 54°, waterproof, comfortable. I have two dogs that I walk through fields every day. These boots have been my year-round footwear for walking my dogs whether it's been raining, snowing or just morning dew.
review.name: Best boot ever in my 73 years

name: Whiteout Faded Boot - Women's

review.reviewBody: Went on a trip to Escalante with the pooch and this bag worked out really well for him, he ran scraped, swam, and lugged it around a 15-mile overnight hike, and worked out so well for him. The removable packs stay on really well. Easy to balance and comes with two 1 liter bags so they can carry their own water. Straps work well to strap on the harness to his body size. Would definately reccomend this for the adventure pup in your life.
review.name: Awesome for the adventure dog.

review.reviewBody: Hearty flannel shirt - perfect for a college student on those cold blustery days. Snuggly warm and washes well! Nice fit and great quality...well worth it!
review.name: I'm Addicted to this Flannel Shirt....

review.reviewBody: Excellent comfort. Goes well on winter days. Slightly loose fit. Get a size lower if you want it to hug your body.
review.name: Very comfortable winter shirt

review.reviewBody: Got the same style in two colors. Good for the cool mornings or nights where you don't want to wear a heavy jacket or sweater but still need something to stay warm.
review.name: Comfortable

review.reviewBody: Great for those cool mornings or nights where you don't need something so heavy but a long sleeve t-shirt is not enough to keep you comfortable.
review.name: Comfortable

review.reviewBody: From day one, it's been one of my favorite flannel shirts! The fabric is soft and warm, and the fit is just right, making it the perfect go-to for any casual outing. I can't help but feel cozy every time I wear it!

review.reviewBody: I have purchased several of North Face's flannel-style button shirts, and I have to say this Arroyo Flannel is definitely my favorite of the bunch. Decided to buy in different colors. Might try the "lightweight" version next!
review.name: North Face's Best Flannel Shirt

review.reviewBody: This shirt was better than what I thought. The quality and style are amazing!!
review.name: I will buy it again and i also recommends this to my friends

review.reviewBody: Awesomely comfortable shirt, has the broken in feel from day one.
review.name: Great flannel!

review.reviewBody: For some reason this is the absolute best fitting shirt I own, let alone its comfort. I have 3 of these now in different colors - they just fit great!
review.name: Fit and feel great!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Great color and great quality, will be buying more in the fall.

review.reviewBody: I have bad ankles with arthritis but when I put these on it was instant comfort. I think it has to do with the right slant on the sole!
review.name: Love them

review.reviewBody: They fit perfectly, easy to put on and very comfortable. I would recommend these to others who are looking for similar styles of shoes.
review.name: Love them!

review.reviewBody: Perfect sandal! Cute and comfortable sandal that stays put, color goes with everything, absolutely love!
review.name: Cute and Comfy

review.reviewBody: I like be these sandals. They are comfortable right out of the Bo’s with excellent support and cushioning. I do think they run small. My foot measures 7.5 so I often buy a size 8 to ensure enough room when I walk all day. I wish I had purchased an 8.5. Too late to exchange as I’m heading on a month long trip. I’m keeping my fingers crossed they work out.
review.name: Runs Small

review.reviewBody: Love these. Great walking sandals. I'm an 8 normally and the 8 sandal fit perfectly. There is a nice bounce and support. I'll buy every color.
review.name: Love these perfect walking sandals.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I like these Elle Backstrap Sandals a lot. They are comfortable & stylish and fit me perfectly! I’m very pleased with my purchase.
review.name: Very comfortable & stylish

review.reviewBody: I love these sandals and will replace them with the exact same pair when these wear out. I wore them all over NYC and my feet and legs never hurt. They match just about everything too so that’s nice. Great buy!
review.name: So comfortable

review.reviewBody: I like Keen shoes classic fit styles because I need a wide toe box but a regular fit for my heel. Many shoes either scrunch my toes or are so loose at the heel (wide sizes) that I will get blisters. It’s hard to find a good fit for my feet. That said, this pair of sandals fit my feet great! They have a lot of cushion and are very comfortable to wear. The straps secure the foot without pinching. I appreciate the style as I can wear them with casual clothing or with a little dressier outfit. I have walked several miles in them already and have had zero foot pain. If you have a foot shape similar to mine, I think you will be pleased with this pair of sandals.
review.name: Versatile, comfortable sandals.

review.reviewBody: Very comfortable. No breaking in period. Love them!
review.name: Very comfortable. No breaking in

review.reviewBody: Comfortable fit, walked around a lot very comfortable. I had some compliments on the style. I have many Keen shoes but these are my new favs!
review.name: New favorite!

description: Buy the Osprey Packs Downburst 36L Backpack - Men's online or shop all Accessories from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Downburst 36L Backpack - Men's
hasVariant.description: Buy the Osprey Packs Downburst 36L Backpack - Men's online or shop all Accessories from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] excellent
review.name: excellent

review.reviewBody: Pumped on this kit :)) can’t wait to start traveling !!! No worries at all with keeping things dry ! The frame ,. The straps , the weight everything is perrrrrrfect !! I’m 6’0 190lbs . Didn’t have to adjust a thing straight out of the box .
review.name: Wicked Dry / Waterproof Backpack

review.reviewBody:
I spent a lot of time hiking in the Pacific Northwest, and let me tell you, it's wet. Very wet. We get 9 months of rain here, and sometimes you practically have to swim to work.
Having the appropriate gear which enables your to comfortably enjoy the great PNW year-round was life changing. Downburst helps you hang in what weather you would expect from the name. When you can rest assured that all your important supplies are as dry as the desert you can really cut loose! And let me tell you, walking the wild forests beneath the pouring rain is a primal and beautiful experience. Doing it dry, warm, and comfortable feels like an unbelievable privilege. Sometimes a raincover doesn't cut it, and your suspension system will get soaked even with the best of raincovers. Do yourself a favor and invest into an all around waterproof pack!
Beyond all this, Osprey is pushing the industry boundaries for waterproofing technology, and they are doing it with sustainable and safe chemistry in mind. 
If you live in a wet area, there is no other pack I would recommend.
review.name: No Such Thing as Bad Weather, Only Bad Equipment

name: Downburst 36L Backpack - Men's

review.reviewBody:
Holy cow do these pants run REALLY small in the waist! I sized up based on reviews and figuring that would suffice to allow wearing these over a light layer  if needed, and they were still too small in the waist to potentially make use of. 

I normally take a medium in most pants, but even sized up I could barely button these and was concerned the buttons would tear if I tried wearing these in active use. Kind of silly I should have to size up another size. 

Definitely a shame, because they have a nice trim silhouette to them that's appealing for an active ski pant, instead the usually bloated clown pant fit that most pants have these days and that drives me nuts.
review.name: Run way small

review.reviewBody: I only used them for 4 days in Telluride skiing and they had ripped after the 3rd day. They fill nice and fit pretty well if you size up but quality is very questionable
review.name: They run small and rip easily

review.reviewBody:
Nice pants but they wear too tight. I am always a M and I could not close the waist buttons so need a L and Backcountry does not have in stock:( 

I was very disappointed to see that after spending $280 i needed to pay for shipping back to them. Last time I am purchasing from Back country!
review.name: Disappointed with backcountry and size

review.reviewBody: I bought these for hiking and mountaineering in snow which MAY NOT be the expected use of these pants. they move very well with my body specifically they don't restrict me when high stepping. the gaiter section of majority of the snow pants are very bulky which make the use of crampons very complicated, but the gaiter section of these pants are the same size and profile of normal pants which makes snowshoeing and use of crampons very easy and safe. however, for deep snow I had to use a real gaiter on top of my pants and boots to stop the snow from getting up into my pants and socks. the ventilation works good but I wish it was a bit larger. I would say that during high intensity activities I have to wear a very thin wool layer under these pants otherwise the inside of the pants would feel super wet and damp from my sweat even with the ventilations fully open but with that thin layer and taking a few more breaks everything feels very comfy. with a thicker wool layer I have sat (not moving) in low 20F for extended period of times without feeling cold. pants never got wet from snow (have not tested them in rain). I wear size 32-30 (32-waist and 30-leg) jeans and size medium fits we perfectly.
review.name: if ure looking for hiking pants

review.reviewBody: I tried on many different pairs of pants from REI, Patagonia, and HH and these are the only ones that worked well for me.  In the other brands M was to tight, i had to have them fully adjusted to the largest size they would go and large pants i would swim in and would get super bunched when adjusted to the max.  These pants are comfortable and I am right in the middle of the adjustable range.  They kept me warm and dry from 5 degrees out to 35 degrees.  I would highly recommend.
review.name: Tailored Fit and great performance

review.reviewBody: The ski pants flex with all movements. They are very warm on a negative 20 day skiing. Still very comfortable on days in the teens and twenties. Best ski pants I own. True to size.
review.name: Very Warm and Fexible

review.reviewBody:
Pleasant to touch, well made.
I had to return it .. its too large
review.name: Very well made pants

review.reviewBody: I loved these pants, but just couldn't keep them.  They fit like a stylish slim fit pant I would normally wear, however that means they were way too tight to use as a ski pant.  If you're only going to wear 1 thin baselayer, or none at all, then ordering your normal size might work.  If not, definitely size up.
review.name: Great quality and stylish
comment: I experienced the same - tight fitting pants!

review.reviewBody: I wear a large however like my ski pants to be a little loose. These pants are XL but fit like mediums. I couldn?t believe they got them do wrong. Must be marked wrong! Sending back.
review.name: Too small

review.reviewBody: Haven't had a chance to try these out yet... they seem to run very small.. My son' is 6' , about 150 lbs and a 30/31 waist.... a very thin (runner's body). The quality looks great and I just ordered him both a medium and a large to try. Wondering if they were miss-marked (almost looked like a youth or women's size, as opposed to a men's).
review.name: run very small

name: Alpha Lifaloft Pant - Men's

review.reviewBody: This jacket strikes the perfect balance of form, function, and feminine vibes. Put together enough to complete a look and comfortable enough to feel like your favorite sweater. Just yes!
review.name: Falls cozy comfort!

review.reviewBody: Cute lightweight jacket that keeps the autumn chill out. Love the zip side pockets for security and warmth
review.name: Lightweight and warm

review.reviewBody: I’m one of those people who don’t usually write reviews. This jacket has changed that. It is my absolute favorite thing to wear. Indoors, outdoors, it’s so cozy but not heavy. That proverbial “just right”. I have 2 now and can’t wait for more colors. It’s so great for travel too. Those places where it’s cool at night but warmer during the day, and maybe a little damp too. Sooo good!
review.name: My favorite piece of clothing

review.reviewBody: This is a great fleece jacket. Lots of warmth for the weight. When I saw picture, I thought I would have to size up, as I was concerned about the shoulder and chest area along with maybe the sleeves being too narrow. I ordered a MD instead and it was too big in the body and roomy in the chest. My normal size of SM fit perfect, allowing for a shirt underneath.
review.name: Very comfortable and warm for weight

review.reviewBody: This is a wonderful jacket when you need something for the chill in the air but anything heavy.Great for traveling. Creative use of textures in a neutral color!Love this jacket.
review.name: Lightweight fleece jacket

review.reviewBody: Perfect between seasons. My wife wears this jacket going to work as it has been getting chilly here in Connecticut it the morning. Perfect for early morning boat rides out to the island where it’s not freezing but you need some cover to keep you warm. Shes excited to see how this jacket does from early fall into the winter season.
review.name: Perfect light weight jacket

review.reviewBody: This is my second fleece jacket so that says it all. I love when function meets fashion.
review.name: came back for a second one, different color

review.reviewBody: Love this jacket. Color is great. The fit is perfect. This will be a go to jacket for all occasions and all seasons. Light weight.
review.name: Beautiful all round jacket.

review.reviewBody: I purchased this in Stone, and it was love at first sight. The fabric is so lovely. And I was stunned at how warm it is given it feels lighter weight. I went back and ordered another color. Both are my go-to when I need an added layer. It fits TTS for me in my normal FF size. I love FF and wear it as often as I can, and this is one of my favorite FF pieces to-date.
review.name: A favorite!

review.reviewBody: This is a quality made jacket. The color is a nice muted blueish green. It has an odd fit- very big in the midsection, more like a square-cut men’s jacket. The fabric is super stretchy and it is warm. I like the jacket overall, just wish it was a tad more form fitting.
review.name: W Gridlock Jacket in Stormy Sea

name: Gridback Fleece Jacket - Women's

hasVariant.description: Buy the Marmot Trestles Elite Eco 0 Sleeping Bag: 0F Synthetic online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.itemreviewed: Trestles Elite Eco 0 Sleeping Bag: 0F Synthetic
review.reviewBody: The bag is warm.  I like the inner pocket for my phone.  One flaw: the zipper will not stay zipped up.  It opens up some if I move around.  My Western Mountaineering sleeping bag has Velcro at the top of the zipper to hold the bag closed.  Marmot should add this very inexpensive feature.
review.name: Warm but not great zipper

review.itemreviewed: Trestles Elite Eco 0 Sleeping Bag: 0F Synthetic
review.reviewBody:
Beautiful bag and the footbed is fantastic. But WAY TOO NARROW in the shoulders. Couldn't even zip it up - felt claustrophobic. I am 6'3" and large but not heavy., so was surprised it didn't fit. My chest = 48"; with arms down = 54.5"

Rest of the bag was great - length etc.  Very disappointed
review.name: WAY TOO NARROW

review.itemreviewed: Trestles Elite Eco 0 Sleeping Bag: 0F Synthetic
review.reviewBody: I'm 6'2 and bought the "long" version. it's cut very narrowly through the knees but still, has plenty of room, and the toe box is great. it fits great through the hips and waist but the shoulder is a problem. 100% not the stated 152cm I had to unzip both sides and just use the chest bib with gloves. super disappointed that sleeping bags cannot be returned to Sport Chek (online order)
review.name: Bought the "Long" off at the shoulder dimension

review.itemreviewed: Trestles Elite Eco 0 Sleeping Bag: 0F Synthetic
review.reviewBody:
I have no doubt that this sleeping bag would be warm and at this price point, I was very happy to trade off a bit of weight. However, I found the bag extremely tight at the shoulders. It was tight to zip the bag up and too tight for me to cross my arms across my chest. I'm not a big guy by any estimation. The heights seemed to be very good.

We have Marmot sleeping bags for my children and they're very good.  We like the brand.
review.name: I really wanted to like this sleeping bag.

review.itemreviewed: Trestles Elite Eco 0 Sleeping Bag: 0F Synthetic
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I used this bag in the Aconcagua mountain camps, the highest camp was at 6000 meters above sea level, temperatures around -15 and -25 degrees Celsius. Excellent quality. To increase its temperature I used a liner. It does not compress so much. Its weight is ok. But overall very good sleeping. I recommend it.
review.name: Excelent

review.itemreviewed: Trestles Elite Eco 0 Sleeping Bag: 0F Synthetic
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I tried testing this bag last week during a Montana trip but the overnight low was only in the 40s, so I roasted and switched to a lighter bag for the rest of the trip. I'm 6' 5", 215 lb and found the bag to be a bit snug; but "roomy" translates to a bulkier, heavier bag - and I don't want that either. I really like the foot box construction and look forward to using this bag this fall when temps dip again.
review.name: Nice bag, great loft, a bit snug.

review.itemreviewed: Trestles Elite Eco 0 Sleeping Bag: 0F Synthetic
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I now own three of these bags. After I purchased the first two, I liked them so much better than my other “cold weather” bag that I bought another. They are great for winter backpacking in Michigan. Although they don’t compress as well or weigh as little as expensive down bags, they are relatively light and pack well. They are quite comfortable when used in weather below 20 degrees. The toe box has plenty of room, the baffles are well positioned to retain heat, and the additional small zipper on the opposite side of the main zipper allows you to get both arms out easily when you need to grab something from the tent corner pocket. If I needed a fourth bag for cold weather, I would certainly buy another.
review.name: Great value cold weather bag

review.itemreviewed: Trestles Elite Eco 0 Sleeping Bag: 0F Synthetic
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I have a built-out truck and use this sleeping bag to camp in it in the winter. I have never been cold, despite sleeping in negative-degree temps at times. While this sleeping bag is perfect for my purposes, it is bulky and huge. It's great for car camping because I never have to hike anywhere with it, but I would never use it backpacking.
review.name: Perfect for the price point

review.itemreviewed: Trestles Elite Eco 0 Sleeping Bag: 0F Synthetic
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] While I tend to sleep hot, this bag kept me warm well below the comfort ratings.  I highly recommend this sleeping bag.
review.name: Worth it

review.itemreviewed: Trestles Elite Eco 0 Sleeping Bag: 0F Synthetic
review.reviewBody:
I recommend this bag. This is the best bag that I have camped in. In a tent, it was comfortable at -8.
This is me. Look at the very bottom where it says "Cover"
review.name: I recommend this bag. Best bag that I have camped

name: Trestles Elite Eco 0 Sleeping Bag: 0F Synthetic

hasVariant.description: Buy the Mystery Ranch Catalyst 26 Backpack online or shop all Accessories from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Catalyst 26 Backpack
hasVariant.description: Buy the Mystery Ranch Catalyst 26 Backpack online or shop all Accessories from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Bottles fall right out of the pockets. Zippers have too much resistance so it’s a pain to open and close. The back panel has deformed after 7 months and now pokes me in the upper back and rubs, making the bag now essentially unusable. I suspect this is due to a design flaw of some of the inner organization pockets being too tight to actually put anything in them without bending the panel.
review.name: High hopes. Disappointed.

review.reviewBody: Bought this bag for travel and also as a baby bag. I felt it was the perfect size, had good compartments and can be opened from the top or front so if I need a specific item I don't have to dig everything out to get to it. It's multi use is great and it's a good looking bag as well. I would recommend. Also shipped within the same week!
review.name: love how it opens from top or front

review.reviewBody: I brought this to replace another back pack from a different company where the straps weren’t sewn on correctly and tore. The mystery ranch bag looks much nicer and more solidly made. The contrasting interior is nice and it’s a good size for the plane and taking to a class. I travel a lot for training so this is ideal for me
review.name: Good travel pack

review.reviewBody: I have tried a lot of backpacks for my daily commute, this one is the best so far. It looks clean, not having bunch webbings or cords on the outside of the bag is a key. It doesn’t look “tactical”, so it is kind discrete. I have a 16inch laptop, which fit in the there perfectly.
review.name: Should bought it earlier

review.reviewBody: I have the urban assault 24 and I love it. There are two features on that pack that I’m not a fan of. The water bottle holders and it won’t stand… well they did make some upgrades the bottle holders are a little better. Wish they would expand though. And the main feature upgrade I noticed. It stands on its own. I do think the top pouch is slightly smaller. It seems like a little taller and narrower design with works well. All around love the pack. I think even better than thr urban assault.
review.name: This one stands up!

review.reviewBody:
I bought this pack before a long vacation with a couple of intended uses: 
* Carry-on backpack for air travel 
* Day pack for city tourism
* Day pack for light hiking 

I think that it nailed all 3 of these uses perfectly; after weeks with the pack I have zero complaints about its function. I kept it with me at all times during my trip and there were many occasions where I was happy to have my rain gear, water bottle, or a book so close. 

Some of my favorite features were: 
* The large admin pouch and 2x left/right internal zipper pockets were great for keeping a large quantity of smaller items like chapstick, snacks, small electronic devices, etc. close at hand.
* The tri-zip main compartment was awesome for stuffing rain gear, cold weather clothing, a travel pillow, and other bulky items. 
* The center internal zipper pocket was good for keeping my passport and other important items in a secure location deep within the pack. 
* The non-stretch water bottle holders were the perfect size to securely hold a 1 L Nalgene. This water bottle has over time stretched out the elastic on several other backpacks that I own, so I personally LOVED the non-stretch design.

I was additionally really impressed by how well the pack carries weight; even when loaded up to capacity it distributed weight extremely well across my shoulders and back. I do think that if I were going on longer hikes then I would want a pack with a hip belt, but for shorter ~5 mile hikes this was more than sufficient. 

Since returning from my vacation I have used the pack several times as my only bag for short weekend trips, its size is perfect for carrying a couple changes of clothes and other essentials like toiletries and chargers.

Lastly, the build quality seems to be outstanding. After throwing this pack around for several weeks I can't see even a speck of wear on it. This was a great for purchase and I will be getting a lot of use out of it hopefully for the rest of my life.
review.name: Amazing Quality!

review.reviewBody:
Durable for travel and as a bush pack.
Smart and versatile design to accommodate various types of uses
review.name: Durable and Efficient Design

review.reviewBody: My previous pack for work was top heavy and super annoying. This pack is very well built and has pockets inside that keep everything organized. The laptop sleeve even holds a dell tough book.  This is definitely more of a commuter pack than daypack for hiking.
review.name: Organization

review.reviewBody:
I’ve had the Catalyst 26 for a few weeks now, and overall have been loving it. I use it as an EDC and for weekend travel. 

Pros:
-Size is great
-Love the internal organization
-Water bottle pockets fit 40 oz Hydroflask and 48 oz Nalgene
-Love the narrow profile of the bag
-Construction feels robust/bombproof

Cons:
-When there isn’t much in the main compartment, the brain and base of the bag keep their integrity, but the middle of the bag sags inward toward the laptop compartment. This makes the bag look weird. Perhaps this could be remedied with slightly stiffer/different fabric in that area. 
-Bag tends to lean/pull to one side significantly when only one of the water bottle pockets is used. This may be due to the physics/weight distribution of the bag itself, but I have a slightly larger bag that is able to stay even on the bag with one full water bottle in the side pocket. 

Overall, I love the bag and am confident that it will last for years to come. This is my first MR product, but I would not hesitate to purchase another!
review.name: Great size and organization. Robust construction.

review.reviewBody:
I had previously owned an UA24 and recently updated to the Catalyst 26.
Everything previously familiar with the UA24 is back with a few minor pros and cons.

Pros
- If you pack it appropriately without being top heavy, the Catalyst stands upright on its own. I couldn't do it with the UA24. This is a really big deal especially if you have to air travel. Standing upright just makes your commute easier.

- Some users may not like it, but the recycled Cordura is more crinkly than the UA24. Other than the crinkly sound, I like it as it feels smoother and higher quality. It won't catch as much lint. 

- interior colors are now brighter- it's like a floodlight now in your bag and finding your gear is so much quicker. ( I'm using the Black Catalyst 26)

- top grab handle. It's a real upgrade from the flimsy single band of nylon in previous UA24. Now its double wrapped and it just feels good in your hand.

- internal organization now comes with a very handy mesh zippered pocket in the top half of the bag. Very useful for stashing your EDC that you may need access often. 

Now for some cons.

- due to the new panel design,  the water bottle holders don't allow your bottles to sit as securely. The bottles are angled towards your body ( I suppose for easier access) but unless you are using the right sized bottle,  they may slide out pretty easily.

- the inner 2 water bottle pockets are no longer  in the Catalyst 26. It's not a deal breaker for me.

- interior organization has been improved ,but the layout may not be suitable for everyone 

- top brain pocket can be bigger. It's purely for your essentials. I managed to fit a long passport wallet, keys, and a phone in there.

- I liked the stealthy Double Black colorway of my precious UA24. The Catalyst 26 in black comes with orange accents. Again, may not be to everyone's taste.

- new zippers are S T I C K Y. Needs quite a bit of effort to open.

All in all, a great EDC pack and I love using it for airport commutes. It rides tall and sleek and it's so easy to glide around public spaces. 

Love this piece of kit.
review.name: Excellent update to the UA24

name: Catalyst 26 Backpack

review.itemreviewed: Flashflight LED Light Up Flying Disc
review.reviewBody: This is my 2nd Disc-O. Gotta have a back-up. It's great both night and day. In addition, the light switch on one of my Disc-Os stopped working and Nite-Ize replaced the Disco-O even though it was 2 years old
review.name: Light it Up

review.itemreviewed: Flashflight LED Light Up Flying Disc
review.reviewBody: It is fun and works well.  Great to play with in the dark.
review.name: Fun at Night.

review.itemreviewed: Flashflight LED Light Up Flying Disc
review.reviewBody: I love playing night time frisbee with this desk. But unfortunately, changing the battery has almost always resulted in breaking the battery assembly. This has been the case for me and a couple of my friends. I'm concerned that they will never fix this issue as it encourages folks to buy the frisbee again rather than just the battery - which is very wasteful.
review.name: Flawed Battery Replacement Design
comment: Thank you for taking time to contact Nite Ize and your input regarding the Nite Ize Flashflight. I am very sorry that our product became faulty. At Nite Ize, we pride ourselves in manufacturing high quality products that stand up to the rigors of everyday use. We will always stand behind our products if a customer experiences an issue or would like a replacement item under our warranty policy. Please contact Nite Ize Customer Service for detailed information. In addition, we do have the videos for the Flashflight battery replacement, which may be helpful for you.

review.itemreviewed: Flashflight LED Light Up Flying Disc
review.reviewBody: Well made; brighter than other lighted discs we use; disc is of standard Frizbee design, so it is less comfortable than some newer varieties that light up.  (Remember to wear light clothing; we disappeared, but the disc didn't!)
review.name: Great disc for the dark

review.itemreviewed: Flashflight LED Light Up Flying Disc
review.reviewBody: The product works great but it’s not made for Disc Golf, otherwise known as Glow.  Glow golf is huge and is played with disc golf discs which are much smaller and have a beveled edge.  Currently, we have to use glow discs which are made with glow in the dark plastics which have to be recharged with an LED flash light every few minutes which is very inconvenient compared to your LED discs.  Plus your LED discs are much brighter with a variety of colors.  The first company that starts making disc golf sized LED discs will dominate the market.  If you have made these discs in the past, you need to make them again and do some basic marketing.  This is truly a No Brainer.
review.name: Not for Disc Golf

review.itemreviewed: Flashflight LED Light Up Flying Disc
review.reviewBody: Great quality disc.  Light up colors are vibrant and make playing into the night so fun!  Kids have had fun playing with it in the snow too.  We love ours and will consider more to give as gifts.
review.name: Awesome!

review.itemreviewed: Flashflight LED Light Up Flying Disc
review.reviewBody: Excellent.  Great flight characteristics, and extremely bright (almost blindingly so in total darkness)
review.name: Nighttime blast

review.itemreviewed: Flashflight LED Light Up Flying Disc
review.reviewBody:
Great discs and having plenty of fun.
Lost a battery from hitting a tree. Be good if the batter cover could be screw on rather than push fit
review.name: Super fun, needs some upgrades

review.itemreviewed: Flashflight LED Light Up Flying Disc
review.reviewBody: This is some good stuff. Better than anything else I’ve ever used.
review.name: Some Good Stuff

review.itemreviewed: Flashflight LED Light Up Flying Disc
review.reviewBody: What a great way to burn some energy at night. My husband, daughter and I had fun tossing it around. She is a quality time girl and it is an great way to spend time together at the end of an evening.
review.name: Lots of fun and I would buy it again

name: Flashflight LED Light Up Flying Disc

review.itemreviewed: Genesis GORE-TEX Trail Running Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: I feel the GTX version runs slightly shorter than the normal Genesis. The GTX is definitely stiffer which could be the difference. I love the color way.
review.name: Runs a Little Short
comment: Hi, thank you for sharing your thoughts with us. We always strive to improve! Your feedback has been helpful for us!

review.itemreviewed: Genesis GORE-TEX Trail Running Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody:
Great snug fit typical of Salomon shoes. 
The undersole felt surprisingly thick and padded compared to my previous pair. Initially I wasn’t sure because I can’t “feel” the terrain as much, but I got used to them very quickly and love them! I could walk forever in them. Also I love the colour, not all black but still quite toned down, not bright nor garish, so I can wear these as everyday shoes in town on rainy days.
review.name: Very comfortable shoes

review.itemreviewed: Genesis GORE-TEX Trail Running Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: My first pair of Salomon shoes and I love the fit. Great for scrambling around on trails and dunes in my area. I love the way they hold firmly to my feet when edging.
review.name: First pair

review.itemreviewed: Genesis GORE-TEX Trail Running Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: My 6th or 7th pair of running shoes from Salomon -- reliable as ever -- comfortable, robust, gor-tex waterproof, excellent lace system -- what's not to like?
review.name: Good old Salomon

review.itemreviewed: Genesis GORE-TEX Trail Running Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: I have worn these shoes twice now.  The toe box is too small.  The rest of the shoe fits fine, but the toe is entirely too small.  Compression pain on small toes and big toes within a matter of an hour or two.
review.name: Fit is not so good
comment: Hey, thank you for taking the time to share your feedback with us. We often adjust our products based on direct customer feedback. We will make sure to pass this along to our designers for consideration in future products.

name: Genesis GORE-TEX Trail Running Shoe - Men's

review.itemreviewed: Ona Rmx Chukka WP Plus Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: True to size. Very comfortable and lining is very soft. Super cute and stylish. Good grip and warm. Perfect stylish winter boot!
review.name: Stylish Winter Boot

review.itemreviewed: Ona Rmx Chukka WP Plus Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: Really like them. I like them especially because they kind of look and feel like sneakers which are more comfortable than the usual slushy rain boots I’d wear.
review.name: Chukka

review.itemreviewed: Ona Rmx Chukka WP Plus Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: Warm and very comfortable! Look good too if you like a chunky look. Definitely smaller fit so order half/whole size up would be my advice as per website. Rated as quite wide but I do have a narrow foot so take that with a pinch of salt.
review.name: Great purchase!

review.itemreviewed: Ona Rmx Chukka WP Plus Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: The shoes are so comfortable to wear. They keep my feet warm and dry all at the same time. I have bought many pairs previously and these ones do not disappoint.
review.name: Amazing 🤩

review.itemreviewed: Ona Rmx Chukka WP Plus Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: Some of my favorite Sorels. Warm, waterproof, comfortable, easy to wear, just all around excellent shoe for winter in the city on days where it’s cold and snowy but not SUPER snowy. Most days you don’t need a full-on winter boot, so these are perfect for your average winter day in the city.
review.name: Excellent urban sneaker boot for winter

review.itemreviewed: Ona Rmx Chukka WP Plus Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: Love these boots!  Comfortable, warm and super cute!!!
review.name: Fantastic boot!

review.itemreviewed: Ona Rmx Chukka WP Plus Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: Shipment was quick and shoes fitted very good. Quality is not what I’m used to for Sorel boots. Didn’t feel as solid and bouncy on the soles. I returned the shoes.
review.name: Quality not what I’m used to

review.itemreviewed: Ona Rmx Chukka WP Plus Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody:
I needed boots that would keep my feet warm & dry in the winter during my walk to work. I haven't worn them outdoors yet, but they feel well insulated.  I think the warm & dry part is met. 
However, the tread on these boots is severely lacking. They are cold weather boots, which means they should have proper grip for wet, snowy or icy weather. There is only tread around the perimeter & the center of the sole is flat with no tread/grip. I really like these boots overall, but I worry about slipping & falling easily given the lack of grip/tread on the bottom. Poor design for winter boots.
review.name: Warm Boots, Poor Tread
comment: Hello Ari, we appreciate you sharing your feedback and we're sorry ONA™ RMX Chukka Plus Women's Waterproof Boot didn't meet your standards. We will inform our product team of your concerns and ensure this is fixed for the future.

review.itemreviewed: Ona Rmx Chukka WP Plus Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: These boots look great and are very comfortable. They’re lined with a fleece material inside around the ankle.
review.name: Comfy cute everyday boots

review.itemreviewed: Ona Rmx Chukka WP Plus Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: LOVE these boots. So comfy, warm and waterproof but look really good too!
review.name: Amazing boots

name: Ona Rmx Chukka WP Plus Boot - Women's

review.reviewBody:
Very high quality, with a fabric that seems durable but with a lot of stretch. They fall just below the knee on me, but seem to be okay even with fairly chunky knee pads. However, they are a bit small for a size large (Large is also labeled size 34), and the pockets are useless (there are only 2, one mid-back will only hold your keys, the one in front was unusable for me as it's small and gets crunched while pedaling). I found the Norrona
Fjora Flex1 to have just a bit more room to accommodate armor, as well as a bit more flex and usable pockets and vents, so I kept those instead. However the fabric on the Fjoras feels just a tad less burley than the DHaRCOs.
review.name: High quality

review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] First off, the open front flap makes accessing my gear at the crag so easy. The built in rope tarp is lightweight, incredibly sturdy and just the right size (i use a 70m rope). I like how breathable the straps and back are even though that is not the main thing that I enjoy about this hard structured, EVA-molded backpanel with HDPE framesheet allows me to carry just about any weight on my pack up any approach, steep or long without being bothered. 

There are other wonderful key features of this bag but hats off to you Osprey. You guys made an excellent climbing pack.
review.name: First off, the open front

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This bag is the perfect size and functionality for a long crag day. The straps and hip belt are perfect for harder approaches and the zipper/duffel double feature lets me grab whatever I need without having to empty the whole thing. Nice side pocket for bladder/bottle too. Highly recommend!
review.name: This bag is the perfect

review.reviewBody: Great pack over all! I love that it comes with the tarp! Works great with all my gear and is super comfortable to carry.
review.name: Great Pack

review.reviewBody: Awesome bag that is bomb proof and so easy to pack and unpack with closure. Allows for luxury items with short to medium approach and easy to carry a rope with the top cover. Just wish they had a helmet attachment like some packs so you could have rope on top and helmet on back to help with storage space.
review.name: 45 liter crag - bomber

hasVariant.description: Buy the Mystery Ranch Terraframe 65L Backpack online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: They will sell a pack for 10% off then drop the price 25% off two weeks later and tell you tough luck.
review.name: Don’t buy anything unless it 25% off!!

review.reviewBody: Never looking back to Osprey!! This back is much more durable than your standard rei pack, never once had to worry about it tearing open when I would place it along sharp rocks. The pack itself is really comfortable with its large, thick, shoulder straps & belt straps. It really tightens down firm to your body, doesn’t have any sway or feels like it’s pulling away from you when you’re moving side to side. Holds a lot of gear for 4 days of adventure in the seven devils too. Had 3 pairs of clothes, 4 days of food, plenty of snacks, water, tent, sleeping bag, stove, camera equipment with 2 lenses (20mm, 24-120mm, 70-200mm), a tripod, having it balanced it carried me all the way through the range (34 miles) and back to the car without a SINGLE issue. Some people are worried about how it may way an extra 1lb than your standard 75L Osprey bag, but the extra 1lb helps you with its form and function / comfortability. Don’t sacrifice your comfort over a lightweight flimsy bag. Go durable, go comfort, take care of it and it’ll take care of you. 10/10 bag.
review.name: Out performed my Osprey pack!

review.reviewBody:
I’ve used it with a 22 kilos weight for the first time, I hiked almost 15 kilometres 5 km uphill and 5 km downhill and around 5 km flat 
My first impression was it’s a good backpack, but it was very squeaky, I was walking on a gravel road and I measured how much noise it did while I was walking, this is not science, but it was 57 decibels
review.name: It’s good but no wow!

review.reviewBody:
I just finished my first trip with the Terraframe. The pack is very comfortable, durable, and versatile. As someone in their sixties (and a little overweight) it was easy to get adjusted for my height and size. This pack balanced the load really well over steep and rough terrain.
We camped for three days, using our base camp to hike out to various lakes for fishing. As such, one feature I loved was removing the lid and mounting it to the yoke, making a great day pack.
review.name: Amazing versatility

review.reviewBody: Love the pack. Ive  been using mystery ranch wildland fire packs for 15 years and have loved the way they fit and the craftsmanship / warranty that they offer. The terraframe yolk was just like fitting my fire pack. As soon as I adjusted everything, it was a perfect fit.
review.name: Great pack

review.reviewBody:
Dana Design was my go-to pack in the early 2000s; when it came time for a replacement of course I looked to Mystery Ranch.  I utilized the Terraframe 65 for a 10 day hike covering Yellowstone's Thorofare and a portion of the Teton Wilderness in August 2023.  I am not an ultralight hiker by any means and I was worried about hauling 10 days of food/gear in a 65L pack, but the overload feature did it's job and provided the perfect place to hold my Ursack.  

I hauled along some nonessential camera gear and probably started out at 55lbs but was very comfortable the entire (roughly) 100 mile trip.  The pack was very stable when hiking off trail/over uneven terrain.  My hiking group must have thought I was too comfortable and tried to stash a rock in the pack to slow me down. . . it did not stay there but I probably could have carried it with ease.  

The base weight is heavy for a pack, but I'm willing to haul it based on the quality and versatility the Terraframe offers.  It can also be mildly tedious to fiddle with all the different straps to utilize the overload feature -- but the opportunity to to expand your carrying capacity makes up for that.  

I used the Terraframe for a second Yellowstone backcountry trip in September 2023.  This one was a simple four mile hike into a several night basecamp.  The overload feature was put to use once again for a critical piece of gear. . . a case of Cold Smokes!
review.name: Mystery Ranch makes a great pack.

review.reviewBody:
I was a mountain guide in 2023 leading trips up Mt. Shasta, CA. I purchased this pack in 2022 in preparation of the season. Overall, I was very satisfied with the pack and would buy another, but I wish there were some changes.

Pro’s:
 The overload feature is fantastic. At first I was worried that 65L wouldn’t be large enough, but with the overload feature I was able to carry more than enough. In the photo, I was actually able to fit an entire other 65L pack to carry down when a client was injured. 

The torpedo pouches on the outside are great for ready access for extra snacks, gloves, sunscreen, or anything else you need readily accessible. 

The waist strap is very padded which feels great, it makes carrying heavy loads a breeze.

The build of the pack is great, being one large cavity for the whole extent of the bag and not having a lower separate sleeping bag section. The large zipper allowing access to the interior of the bag is great because I can stash a large med kit deeper in the bag for better packing but still allowing for rapid access in an emergency. 

There are a lot of straps, allowing for a variety of gear attachment ideas. 

Cons:
This pack is HEAVY. If you are into ultralight traveling or want a lighter pack this is not for you.

Secure tool attachment is very limited. There is a center attachment for an ice axe but it is held by bungee and I had issues with it coming loose. If you are planning to carry multiple ice tools or larger gear, you will have an issue. Also carrying crampons is an issue. I prefer carrying crampons on the outside of my pack to not risk damaging other gear, but there are limited options on this pack. You can attach them to the mole webbing on the pack but this can be difficult it you are already carrying an ice axe there and is not as fast as hanging a pouch on the outside of the pack.  

The straps can be a little confusing, not terrible but the buckles on the left and right sides are opposite (male/female) limiting some “creative”ways to carry gear.

Overall though I really enjoyed this pack! It was a great product and I would recommend as a good mountaineering pack!
review.name: Good Basic Mountaineering Pack, Would Make Changes

review.reviewBody: Recently received my pack. I took advantage of the Christmas sales. When I received the pack, I noticed to yoke was the wrong size and immediately called to get the right sized yoke. Customer service immediately dealt with issue and I received a new yoke in a couple of days. I love the fact that the zippers are already sealed. I will be carrying the terraframe next year on the AT so quality is the most important thing. Thats why I bought a mystery ranch product
review.name: Great looking.

review.reviewBody: Bought this pack Summer of '22 to use for backpacking and hunting trips. Have taken it on several backpacking trips and used it to pack out a cow elk last year and it performed flawlessly. Could not say enough great things about this pack. I damaged the pack leading up to an elk hunt this fall (through user error and no fault in design). Contacted Mystery Ranch and they rushed to get it repaired and back to me in time for my hunt.  A few days after receiving the repaired pack I got to use it to pack out my first bull elk. Can not thank the repair team enough for going out of their way to ensure I had it when I needed it the most!
review.name: Best Customer Service in the Game

review.reviewBody: I fight wildfire for the USFS and know what a good pack is! Mystery Ranch is amazing. I have this Terraframe for my personal hikes and camping, and it’s comfortable and great for all-day hiking!
review.name: What You’re Looking For

review.reviewBody: I received this bad for an overnight trip in 2 days and the bag did not have any tags, had dirt on the top of the bag, and on it had someone's shirt inside of the bag. I will update my review if Backcountry can rectify this situation and if I have a bag to use. It otherwise feels great.
review.name: Bag Used: No tags & Shirt inside
comment: We apologize for the inconvenience with your new bag. We've sent you an email to address the issue and enhance your experience.

review.reviewBody: I?m a plus size and short hiker so I needed an adjustable pack. I love the easy access to gear from front, top and bottom.  The only downside is the straps turn in and cut up my shoulders but compared to problems with other packs it?s not the worst.
review.name: Best adjustable pack I could find

review.reviewBody: I bought this specific bra as it doesn’t have any metal parts . I found this type excellent to use if undertaking long walks while carrying a backpack as the metal parts in a normal bra were rubbing against the skin on my back . I will certainly buy again . .
review.name: Excellent Bra ,

review.reviewBody:
Overall this is a good top -I can't really describe it as a bra as it offers little support and is more suited to be called a cropped top. It can be worn under tops and doesn't flare so will sit snug, but the band across the chest seems to have zero stretch at all. I can fit it on because I can squeeze it over my head and am fairly hypermobile enough to slide into it, but it isn't easy to put on at all!

Once on it looks good. I'm a 32C or 32B depending on where I'm at in the month (#ifyouknowyouknow) and would say if you're a 34 band you might struggle with this. I actually have this in beige but in a medium and though the band offered less of a battle to fit on the cup was way too large hence going down to a size small with this one. However; I have noticed the fit between the black/navy and the grey/beige/blue Gaia pants was quite different so I'd wonder if the same could be said for the tops and bras, I wouldn't like to guess as the sizing in the Gaia range seems a bit all over the place! 

It is a well made and mostly flattering top I think. If I were to alter anything I'd possibly make the shoulder bands slightly longer so the front V didn't sit as high, the straps cannot be made longer, the cups have inserts which can be removed and the feel of the fabric is comfy without being the "bamboo" style which tends to bobble, I think this top would fare much better after a few washes (and btw it does wash well and hasn't shrunken in a 40 degree synthetics wash nor a tumble dry).
 I would usually be a fan of the Mindfulness bras (much larger in fit compared to this "bra"!) and would prefer the lower cut but with the Mindfulness bras they offer zero support and I prefer this style for the well constructed feel. 

Would I buy this again? I bought this in the sale and feel like I got a bargain. I would consider another colour if they were also in the sale but I wouldn't be able to justify this at it's full price. But I would recommend it if you are looking for a Yoga bra, are fairly flexible and are not looking for a sweat wicking, max support bra to hold you all in, this is a nice enough bra but it won't do any of those things!
review.name: Comfortable- if you can get it on!

review.reviewBody: Really nice shape that holds really well (doesn't flatten the chest like other sports bras) and a really nice combo with the Gaia jumpsuit
review.name: A hint of cleavage and good support

review.reviewBody: Perfect yoga bra. Provides full support and gives you the perfect flow in practice
review.name: Wonderful yoga bra
comment: I was searching for a comment that would speak to the relevance of this bra in a yoga practice!  I practice Ashtanga, and it is very physical, and a two hour practice.  I love Sweaty Betty as I wear their clothes both for yoga and for my outdoor running.   I will purchase this now knowing it will serve me in my yoga practices.

review.reviewBody: Super soft and comfortable, always need to size up on the bras
review.name: Soft and supportive

review.reviewBody:
The sports bra does a good job as long as you don’t mind the struggle to put it on & off! No fastenings

Love the soft fabric ! Comfortable
review.name: A good sports bra

review.reviewBody: Lovely sports bra, really comfortable, they were out of stock in my usual size so went up a size and it fits fine, it’s super supportive. Like the fact it’s padded especially for colder months, that said if you don’t like it padded they can easily be removed
review.name: Perfect!

review.reviewBody: Have always been a medium with SB bras but this one squashed me flat. Have returned it. Fabric very compressing.
review.name: Very tight fit

review.reviewBody:
The fabric felt lovely, looked like it had the potential to provide enough shape and support but, as with all 'bras' and support tops from SB, not really able to cope with large cupsizes. The side boob and cleavage overspill was too much, thought about trying the next size up but then the band at the bottom wouldnt have been tight enough. 

So a lovely top potentially if you're the right shape for it.
review.name: Potential, but not for large busts
comment:
Hi there,

A massive thank you for taking time out of your day to leave us feedback.

We’re so sorry to hear that our Gaia Yoga Bra didn’t suit as you’d hoped. We’re listening, learning and constantly striving to be better. We will make sure to pass this onto the relevant team.

Should you require any further assistance, our Customer Care Team would be more than happy to help.

Best wishes,
Team SB

review.reviewBody: The best every day sports/yoga bra I've ever purchased! I'm 5'9" 150ish lbs. Bra size is 34DD and the M is a perfect fit.
review.name: Sweaty Betty Yoga Bra

name: Gaia Yoga Bra - Women's

review.reviewBody: I’ve used these to hike in muggy south Florida weather, cold Patagonia mountains, overall daily use including wood working and weightlifting and can honestly say they outdo any other underwear I’ve ever had in all of those places. Everything from comfort to how long I can use them before they stink. 10/10 recommend
review.name: Best underwear I’ve ever owned

review.reviewBody:
Let me preface this by saying, this is solid, comfortable, moisture wicking, odor regulating underwear....that lasts 3 months and costs $50 MSRP.

I've owned four pairs of this now, and all of them have worn through to a see-through mosquito mesh in the thigh area within 6 months. 

AVOID AT ALL COSTS.
Ice Breaker merino wool underwear fits better and wears better.
There is no excuse for selling a product THIS bad.
review.name: Worst underwear ever

review.reviewBody: Fits to size. Takes a few days to start smelling. 2nd pair I bought.
review.name: Very comfy
